[{'created': '2011-10-26 17:05:59.000000000', 'message': 'Disable SQLite synchronous mode during tests

SQLite uses synchronous mode by default, which will synchronously write
data to disk. This will increase durability of data at the expense of
performance. The test suite does not need data to be durably written
to disk, so disabling synchronous mode results in a speeding up the
full test suite by about 20 seconds.

Change-Id: I5ca1ab1e8691e912d801fe1002dff752c82f3d5d

commit_message:
Disable SQLite synchronous mode during tests

SQLite uses synchronous mode by default, which will synchronously write
data to disk. This will increase durability of data at the expense of
performance. The test suite does not need data to be durably written
to disk, so disabling synchronous mode results in a speeding up the
full test suite by about 20 seconds.

Change-Id: I5ca1ab1e8691e912d801fe1002dff752c82f3d5d

commit_message:
Adds quantum and kombu to buildout.

Fixes bug 884422. With this fix you can run bin/buildout followed by python bin/test and actually have the tests run.

commit_message:
Updating images tests

- Consolidating glance/images test modules.
- Consolidating all glance tests into a single ami-specific test
- Test now cleans up images it pushes into glance
- Updating links for sample ami-style image
- Updating config variables for ami-style image pieces

Change-Id: Ie0aaec36eca8425b687740b289fce6964b13fdbd

subject: Creating uuid -> id mapping for S3 Image Service
messages:
[{'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-20 17:27:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-20 17:27:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This depends on https://review.openstack.org/#change,987 in glance.'}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-10-20 18:13:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(4 inline comments)

Looks good aside from some minorly small things.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-20 18:28:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-20 18:28:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (4 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-24 18:22:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-24 18:26:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Just rebasing.

This can absolutely land without the glance uuids branch, btw. It won't get us much in the way of functionality, but once Glance switches to uuids in API v2.0 Nova will be ready."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-24 19:00:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-24 20:12:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2011-10-25 13:54:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

The ordering doesn't seem quite right here. I would expect 'My Backup' (which was created last) to be at the end of the image list:

root@nova1:~# euca-describe-images 
IMAGE	ami-00000001	None (My Backup)		creating	privatemachine		
IMAGE	ami-00000002	None (squeeze)		available	public		machine"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-25 14:14:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I'm not sure why the id itself matters as long as it is consistent. 

As a side note: if you do an image list, create a backup, then list again, it will be in the right order."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-25 14:29:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-10-27 17:04:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Thanks for the updates.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-27 17:13:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-27 17:31:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2011-10-27 17:40:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Waldon:

The ordering is just confusing to me. I suppose AMI ID's can be whatever. It used to be that they appeared to be monotonically increasing. Now they don't.

One question here since I missed the boat on reviewing the Glance UUID branch. Why didn't we keep an actual integer ID in the Glance image format. I mean it makes sense that the Glance v1 API could have kept that as is for stability and in Glance v2 would could implement the integer ID as an extensions or whatever. The S3 mapping table would be un-needed if we did it that way."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-27 17:46:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

"The ordering is just confusing to me. I suppose AMI ID's can be whatever. It used to be that they appeared to be monotonically increasing. Now they don't."

I think they will, for the most part. I agree the initial assignment of ids to uuids isn't perfect, as newer images will actually have lower ids. However, once you create a new snapshot, it will be assigned the highest int id.

"One question here since I missed the boat on reviewing the Glance UUID branch. Why didn't we keep an actual integer ID in the Glance image format. I mean it makes sense that the Glance v1 API could have kept that as is for stability and in Glance v2 would could implement the integer ID as an extensions or whatever. The S3 mapping table would be un-needed if we did it that way."

Integer IDs aren't unique enough once we get to multi-zone deployments, so I feel like we needed to get rid of them at some point anyways. Why not now?'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2011-10-27 18:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Waldon:

"Why not now?"

Stability! We've already cut releases against the glance v1 API and we just changed it in a way which may break many things.'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2011-10-27 18:26:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Doesn't seem relevant to me to talk about this changeset as if it decides what goes into glance. Glance already switched its v1 api to use image uuids. Perhaps the mailing list would be a better place to discuss whether or not the changes already made in glance should stay."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-28 13:43:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2011-10-28 14:23:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

Waldon:

I'm seeing some failures in the EC2 image tests:

commit_message:
Creating uuid -> id mapping for S3 Image Service

This creates a mapping of Glance uuids to preserve the
EC2-specific image id format. This adds a lazily generated
mapping layer that is stored in the database.

This also fixes bug 882658

Change-Id: I64bf6c7297b97f206b967781a28791aa3874ca81

[{'created': '2011-10-28 21:38:03.000000000', 'message': 'Migrates Horizon to use KeystoneClient

References blueprint novaclient-migration. Fixes bug 848399. As a bonus it also fixes bug 882784.

This merge moves Horizon off of openstackx and novaclient for authentication and keystone management. Instead it uses the new python-keystoneclient library.

'}]
commit_message:
Migrates Horizon to use KeystoneClient

References blueprint novaclient-migration. Fixes bug 848399. As a bonus it also fixes bug 882784.

This merge moves Horizon off of openstackx and novaclient for authentication and keystone management. Instead it uses the new python-keystoneclient library.

Change-Id: Idce4410b473aa51539f2246e8d852a7fe0aeb349

subject: Adding the concept of creating a Keystone HTTP client in Python which can be used in Keystone and imported from Keystone to allow for easier Keystone integration.
messages:
[{'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-10-24 19:29:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

As a note, the next step would be to use this client in areas such as the auth_token middleware and the auth_ec2 middleware to reduce logic duplication.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2011-10-24 19:32:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Awesome across the board! Keystone really needed this.

My only concern is whether or not this should live inside keystone or not... I'd like it to be tested with keystone, but I don't want people to have to install a keystone server & all of it's dependencies, just to get a lightweight client... thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-10-24 19:54:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Adding the concept of creating a Keystone HTTP client in Python which can be
used in Keystone and imported from Keystone to allow for easier Keystone
integration.

Currently this client is only v2.0. One client for dealing with the Service
API and one client for dealing with the Admin API.

Tests included.

Change-Id: I1ea74c105e1f641a8ee96de7573c93dffba2e17a

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-10-28 15:48:34.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes LP Bug#882585 - Backend storage disconnect

Adds a checking iterator to wrap the main image_iter
returned via the show() method on the images controller.
This checked_iter validates that the image is fully
transferred from the backend storage and raises an
IOError if the chunked reads do not transfer the expected
number of bytes.

Change-Id: Icf9b303aa8c2c9c728581d59029fd2c29ddb6da5
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes LP Bug#882585 - Backend storage disconnect

Adds a checking iterator to wrap the main image_iter
returned via the show() method on the images controller.
This checked_iter validates that the image is fully
transferred from the backend storage and raises an
IOError if the chunked reads do not transfer the expected
number of bytes.

Change-Id: Icf9b303aa8c2c9c728581d59029fd2c29ddb6da5

commit_message:
Moving contributor docs into rst (bug #843056)

- Added "Setting up a development environment" doc
  - Removed related info from pip-requires & project README
- Added "Testing" doc
  - Removed related info from project README
- Also removed contributor doc build info from project README (bug #843056)
- Updated version string to '2012.1-dev'

Change-Id: I58c79acd91dc391e3fa85911d09f74ad54d9d444

commit_message:
Relaxing FlavorsTest entity checking

There's already an extension in nova that changes the flavor entity, so
we need to change the check to look for a minimum set of keys.

Change-Id: I585e167908718805e36c9cdb88940e9ca0c06ec5

(pre)$ ./run_tests.sh -N nova.tests.test_quantum:QuantumNovaIPAMTestCase

commit_message:
Adding bulk create fixed ips. The true issue here 
is the creation of IPs in the DB that are not 
currently used(we are building the entire block).
This fix is just a bandaid, but it does cut ~25 
seconds off of the quantum tests on my laptop.

(pre)$ ./run_tests.sh -N nova.tests.test_quantum:QuantumNovaIPAMTestCase
QuantumNovaIPAMTestCase
    test_allocate_and_deallocate_instance_dynamic               OK  11.36
    test_allocate_and_deallocate_instance_static                OK  11.27
    test_create_and_delete_nets                                 OK  10.35
    test_validate_bad_network                                   OK  0.10

(post)$ ./run_tests.sh -N nova.tests.test_quantum:QuantumNovaIPAMTestCase
QuantumNovaIPAMTestCase
    test_allocate_and_deallocate_instance_dynamic               OK  2.94
    test_allocate_and_deallocate_instance_static                OK  3.12
    test_create_and_delete_nets                                 OK  1.86
    test_validate_bad_network                                   OK  0.11
    

Change-Id: I46b629f9ca6e019c7c4c6aa8e869c551e5c13fb8

subject: Fix overzealous use of faults.Fault() wrapper
messages:
[{'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-10-27 14:18:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve Looks good, thanks!'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-27 14:40:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this (1 inline comment) So there *is* a reason all of these extensions explicitly wrap webob exceptions in Fault(). If anything, we should make sure they all wrap, not just some. I'm not exactly sure what it is, but it is obvious if you remove the explicit Fault() wrap the exception returned to the user is formatted as plain text/html, not json or xml. To test this, I deployed master and requested this url: http://localhost:8774/v1.1/admin/os-volumes/1 I had no volumes set up, so I got the following response: < HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found < Content-Length: 78 < Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8 < Date: Thu, 27 Oct 2011 14:39:04 GMT < {"itemNotFound": {"message": "The resource could not be found.", "code": 404}} After removing the Fault() wrap in the show method in the volumes extension controller and making the same request, I get the following output: < HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found < Content-Length: 154 < Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8 < Date: Thu, 27 Oct 2011 14:35:19 GMT < 404 Not Found

404 Not Found

The resource could not be found.

There's definitely more going on here than is immediately obvious.'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2011-10-27 16:21:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment) It's not clear to me if you're agreeing that manually wrapping faults.Fault is a problem or if you think every exception should be manually wrapped, but here's my reasoning behind the patch: 1) It's silly to manually wrap all exceptions in faults.Fault. It should be done automatically if it's done at all. 2) The existing code is inconsistent. It sometimes uses faults.Fault and sometimes doesn't. See point 1. As far as 404 errors go, I can't reproduce your results. If I remove the faults.Fault() wrapper, then I still get a JSON 404. I even confirmed that I'm raising a bare exception versus returning a wrapped exception. However, if you request a URL that doesn't match a route, then you get a text 404. This is likely because it happens in the route matching code before we can catch the exception and catch it. This doesn't appear to be any different pre or post my patch. If you're still seeing the same behavior, can you show me the exact command you're using to reproduce it?"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-27 16:56:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment) I am absolutely for removing Faults, but from my initial testing it seemed like there was more to this than simply removing the Fault wraps. I'm working on reproducing this on your branch. I initially tested my modifying master."}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2011-10-27 17:26:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment) My testing and auditing the code makes me believe that the branch is fine. I do have a couple of more changes to push up in a new patch set. Which I'll do shortly."}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2011-10-27 18:00:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2011-10-27 18:14:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-27 19:19:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Okay, so I don't know how I generated the poorly-formated errors earlier. Code looks good now. Thanks, Johannes!"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-27 19:19:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve '}, {'account_id': 357, 'date': '2011-10-27 23:55:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, approved '}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-10-27 23:56:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Build Started https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova/121755/ (1/3)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-10-27 23:56:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Build Started https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova-pep8/1614/ (2/3)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-10-27 23:56:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Build Started https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova-merge/241/ (3/3)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-10-28 00:04:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified Build Successful https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova-merge/241/ : SUCCESS https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova/121755/ : SUCCESS https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova-pep8/1614/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-10-28 00:04:51.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

wsgi.Resource will automatically wrap HTTP exceptions in faults.Fault()

Change-Id: I297a4decbd4a00fb12ec471a5e76aeea3dda6d34

Also, let's raise exceptions instead of returning them to be consistent.

Change-Id: I297a4decbd4a00fb12ec471a5e76aeea3dda6d34

commit_message:
Fix overzealous use of faults.Fault() wrapper

wsgi.Resource will automatically wrap HTTP exceptions in faults.Fault()
but many extensions will unnecessarily wrap HTTP exceptions manually.
Also, let's raise exceptions instead of returning them to be consistent.

Change-Id: I297a4decbd4a00fb12ec471a5e76aeea3dda6d34

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-10-27 02:18:05.000000000', 'message': "Revert how APIs get IP address info for instances

Fixes bug 862839

listing instances with IPs is extremely inefficient after changes were
made to query the network manager for IP information for each instance.
I tried adding a network manager call that said 'give me IP information
for 'x' instances', but that was also too slow.

We need a solution that caches IP info from the network manager before
we can fully untie things.  So, this reverts APIs to use
instance['fixed_ips'] which hasn't been untied in the DB yet.

Change-Id: I37d21105d6306f0a812c5eb0f0717a5094cd17b9
"}]
commit_message:
Revert how APIs get IP address info for instances

Fixes bug 862839

listing instances with IPs is extremely inefficient after changes were
made to query the network manager for IP information for each instance.
I tried adding a network manager call that said 'give me IP information
for 'x' instances', but that was also too slow.

We need a solution that caches IP info from the network manager before
we can fully untie things.  So, this reverts APIs to use
instance['fixed_ips'] which hasn't been untied in the DB yet.

Change-Id: I37d21105d6306f0a812c5eb0f0717a5094cd17b9

commit_message:
Add .gitreview config file for gerrit.

The CI team is developing a new tool, git-review:

  https://github.com/openstack-ci/git-review

which is intendend to replace rfc.sh.  This adds a .gitreview file
so that it can automatically determine the canonical gerrit location
for the repository when first run.  Later, rfc.sh will be updated to
indicate it is deprecated, and then eventually removed.

Change-Id: I12e6814796df23fa1be4fa2b3e6427381b218461

commit_message:
Add .gitreview config file for gerrit.

The CI team is developing a new tool, git-review:

  https://github.com/openstack-ci/git-review

which is intendend to replace rfc.sh.  This adds a .gitreview file
so that it can automatically determine the canonical gerrit location
for the repository when first run.  Later, rfc.sh will be updated to
indicate it is deprecated, and then eventually removed.

Change-Id: Ifc1d34143b1b90faa4324f7750bfc43f69a5f494

I've got an integration functional test ready to go into the openstack_vpc ruby 1.1 tests once this is fixed.

We already "coverage" on rebuild w/ personalities in the unit tests:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/tests/api/openstack/test_server_actions.py#L386

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/tests/api/openstack/test_server_actions.py#L367

IMHO the type of test we need here is an integration test. This is a cross service issue where you need the full stack (API, Compute, and an instance with an Agent) installed to make sure it works:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/881649'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-26 14:16:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Convert image id value to a uuid

This just changes the value of image.id, leaving the key name alone. We also
enforce image ids provided on an image create be a uuid. Implements
blueprint uuid-image-identifiers

Change-Id: I22ba69550ccbc04a24d680748d60414d2d0f1a99

commit_message:
Fix deletion of instances without fixed ips.

Catch exception when there are no fixed ips for an instance when deallocating it.

When trying to delete failed builds I got the following traces:

(nova.rpc): TRACE: Traceback (most recent call last):
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/nova/rpc/impl_kombu.py", line 620, in _process_data
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     rval = node_func(context=ctxt, **node_args)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/nova/network/manager.py", line 252, in deallocate_for_instance
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     fixed_ips = self.db.fixed_ip_get_by_instance(context, instance_id)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/nova/db/api.py", line 392, in fixed_ip_get_by_instance
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     return IMPL.fixed_ip_get_by_instance(context, instance_id)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py", line 120, in wrapper
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     return f(*args, **kwargs)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py", line 877, in fixed_ip_get_by_instance
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     raise exception.FixedIpNotFoundForInstance(instance_id=instance_id)
(nova.rpc): TRACE: FixedIpNotFoundForInstance: Instance 37 has zero fixed ips.

Which this commit fixes.

Added myself to Authors as requested.

Change-Id: I87a1764c16328c6a4bfa5a0bfab1ea4800cbb355

subject: Adding support for retrying glance image downloads.
messages:
[{'account_id': 360, 'date': '2011-10-26 18:51:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve
Note that Naveed is the Author (but I uploaded it).
---
Naveed this looks good. Should we make the timeout configurable? Currently it looks like it sleeps for 1 second between retries. Just wondering if making that time configurable would also make a difference in practice.
I'm good with this as is however."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-10-27 02:40:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think we want retries on more than just a 'get'.  No?"}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-10-27 03:02:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Discussed with Gabe.  Good with how this is for now.  I have ideas regarding DNS round-robining and retries that requires larger work that we should discuss and do later.  Gabe wants to comment before I +2 this.'}, {'account_id': 927, 'date': '2011-10-27 03:13:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

subject: Adds TrustedComputingPools support
messages:
[{'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-09-27 18:42:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This is a pretty large addition to Nova based on a blueprint marked in 'discussion'. A couple points:

1) Make sure to read the HACKING file in Nova for guidelines to follow (docstring formatting, etc.)

2) The concept of 'trusted computing pools' is a bit strange to me, as such a lot of the code for the client/server in scheduler/attestation is difficult to read. For example "PcrMask" and "trust levels".

These two things being said, I don't have a lot of experience in working with the scheduler, so I'll try to give you good feedback, but hopefully someone else might be able to provide better (more scheduler-specific) feedback.

Long story short, I would love to make sure that this blueprint be "approved" before we merge this code.'}, {'account_id': 849, 'date': '2011-09-27 23:21:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Brian,
1. Catching up blueprint process for approval currently
2. On trust level - two reason to convert [trusted, untrusted] into internal level values.  a) User friendly usage with [trusted, untrusted], but these strings are not easy for internal comparison especially when operators ">=" "<" are used.  b) as attestation usage model is evolving forward - cloud subscribers can specify VM to run on a host meets basic criteria, for example, host with BIOS version xxx and Xen yyy, and doesn't care Dom0 measurement.  In such usage model, Cloud provider can define extra trust levels for subscribers to use.

Thanks,'}, {'account_id': 849, 'date': '2011-10-11 15:38:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 849, 'date': '2011-10-27 01:47:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

reworked'}]

Spec/Wiki http://wiki.openstack.org/TrustedComputingPools

Added json_filter_integrity to support scheduler to filter ['=', $trust_state.trust_lvl, 'trusted'] for selecting trusted nodes for computing

Change-Id: I101485f7bc28f8a5e9a1b69f4ebb0ba5a644e83e

commit_message:
Adds TrustedComputingPools support

Implements blueprint Trusted Computing Pools with
blueprint https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/trusted-computing-pools
Spec/Wiki http://wiki.openstack.org/TrustedComputingPools

Added json_filter_integrity to support scheduler to filter ['=', $trust_state.trust_lvl, 'trusted'] for selecting trusted nodes for computing

Change-Id: I101485f7bc28f8a5e9a1b69f4ebb0ba5a644e83e

commit_message:
Revert how APIs get IP address info for instances

Fixes bug 862839

listing instances with IPs is extremely inefficient after changes were
made to query the network manager for IP information for each instance.
I tried adding a network manager call that said 'give me IP information
for 'x' instances', but that was also too slow.

We need a solution that caches IP info from the network manager before
we can fully untie things.  So, this reverts APIs to use
instance['fixed_ips'] which hasn't been untied in the DB yet.

Change-Id: I6498fbcf1b0101ff1f8bf75423bd20a38de9d677

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-10-24 19:28:18.000000000', 'message': "Adds Driver Layer to Image Cache

Fixes LP Bug#879136 - keyerror: 'image' when doing nova image-list
Fixes LP Bug#819936 - New image cache breaks Glance on Windows

This patch refactors the image cache further by adding an
adaptable driver layer to the cache. The existing filesystem-based
driver that depended on python-xattr and conditional fstab support
has been moved to /glance/image_cache/drivers/xattr.py, and a new
default driver is now based on SQLite and has no special requirements.

The image cache now contains a simple interface for pruning the
cache. Instead of the logic being contained in
/glance/image_cache/pruner.py, now the prune logic is self-contained
within the ImageCache.prune() method, with pruning calling the
simple well-defined driver methods of get_least_recently_accessed()
and get_cache_size().

Adds a functional test case for the caching middleware and adds
documentation on how to configure the image cache drivers.

TODO: cache-manage middleware...
TODO: cache management docs

Change-Id: Id7ae73549d6bb39222eb7ac0427b0083fd1af3ec

commit_message:
Adds Driver Layer to Image Cache

Fixes LP Bug#879136 - keyerror: 'image' when doing nova image-list
Fixes LP Bug#819936 - New image cache breaks Glance on Windows

This patch refactors the image cache further by adding an
adaptable driver layer to the cache. The existing filesystem-based
driver that depended on python-xattr and conditional fstab support
has been moved to /glance/image_cache/drivers/xattr.py, and a new
default driver is now based on SQLite and has no special requirements.

The image cache now contains a simple interface for pruning the
cache. Instead of the logic being contained in
/glance/image_cache/pruner.py, now the prune logic is self-contained
within the ImageCache.prune() method, with pruning calling the
simple well-defined driver methods of get_least_recently_accessed()
and get_cache_size().

Adds a functional test case for the caching middleware and adds
documentation on how to configure the image cache drivers.

TODO: cache-manage middleware...
TODO: cache management docs

Change-Id: Id7ae73549d6bb39222eb7ac0427b0083fd1af3ec

[{'created': '2011-10-20 18:15:03.000000000', 'message': "Don't leak exceptions out to users

Fixed bug 874472

Exceptions can contain all kinds of sensitive information, including
SQL queries (and arguments), configuration information and in some
cases the correct password (bug 868360). The information isn't useful
to users, so don't return potentially sensitive information. The
exceptions still get logged for debugging and troubleshooting purposes.

(cherry picked from commit 2431b7848d633dc67ad684b4d1cc79468df24568)

Change-Id: I45af83ee5276b92259522a4761137d7339d2b77d
"}]
commit_message:
Don't leak exceptions out to users

Fixed bug 874472

Exceptions can contain all kinds of sensitive information, including
SQL queries (and arguments), configuration information and in some
cases the correct password (bug 868360). The information isn't useful
to users, so don't return potentially sensitive information. The
exceptions still get logged for debugging and troubleshooting purposes.

(cherry picked from commit 2431b7848d633dc67ad684b4d1cc79468df24568)

Change-Id: I45af83ee5276b92259522a4761137d7339d2b77d

commit_message:
Removed callback concept on VM driver methods:

 * pause
 * unpause
 * suspend
 * resume
 * rescue
 * unrescue

Worked off blueprint remove-virt-driver-callbacks

Change-Id: Ie3ef4c8155320f72106d7a39e5817516e180ba52

commit_message:
Removing glance-upload

The glance-upload tool targets a very specific use-case that is easily
handled by simply using the standard glance client. It's not worth keeping
around. This addresses bug 767344.

Change-Id: Ie7cf42ba517b744a2a440deb15336c0ee372b2e7

commit_message:
Make sure unknown extensions return 404

At the moment, if an extension doens't exist and we call a show method
with wrong id then the exception is not captured. There is a need to
return NOTFOUND exception.
Fixes bug 869153.

(cherry picked from commit 2915e6ba054b1f4100f788603358ea5b2b8220d5)

Change-Id: Ia20acf28389ca91308b62388e1e0d2fe4c227047

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-10-25 11:00:56.000000000', 'message': 'Include original exception in ClassNotFound exception

By doing this, we allow the error messages to be more useful. When an import
of a class fails because of a missing module dependency, it would have fail
that way for example:

$ nova-manage
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./bin/nova-manage", line 84, in <module>
    from nova import image
  File "/home/jd/Work/src/nova/nova/image/__init__.py", line 22, in <module>
    from nova.image import glance
  File "/home/jd/Work/src/nova/nova/image/glance.py", line 42, in <module>
    GlanceClient = utils.import_class('glance.client.Client')
  File "/home/jd/Work/src/nova/nova/utils.py", line 66, in import_class
    raise exception.ClassNotFound(class_name=class_str)
nova.exception.ClassNotFound: Class Client could not be found

This does not help the user, since it indicates the class Client cannot be
found, even if it is actually found but fail to import.

With this commit, the error message is better:
nova-manage
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./bin/nova-manage", line 84, in <module>
    from nova import image
  File "/home/jd/Work/src/nova/nova/image/__init__.py", line 22, in <module>
    from nova.image import glance
  File "/home/jd/Work/src/nova/nova/image/glance.py", line 42, in <module>
    GlanceClient = utils.import_class('glance.client.Client')
  File "/home/jd/Work/src/nova/nova/utils.py", line 66, in import_class
    raise exception.ClassNotFound(class_name=class_str, exception=exc)
nova.exception.ClassNotFound: Class Client could not be found: No module named kombu.connection

This helps to know that in this kombu is missing.

It would probably even better to rename ClassNotFound to
ClassCannotBeImported or something like that too.

(cherry picked from commit 33e58925c75b66c6800d3ba6068ee1e4f0db6617)

Change-Id: I50c591b54820ae734e5d1dccedf6653c5c9d40f9
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien.danjou@enovance.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Include original exception in ClassNotFound exception

By doing this, we allow the error messages to be more useful. When an import
of a class fails because of a missing module dependency, it would have fail
that way for example:

$ nova-manage
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./bin/nova-manage", line 84, in <module>
    from nova import image
  File "/home/jd/Work/src/nova/nova/image/__init__.py", line 22, in <module>
    from nova.image import glance
  File "/home/jd/Work/src/nova/nova/image/glance.py", line 42, in <module>
    GlanceClient = utils.import_class('glance.client.Client')
  File "/home/jd/Work/src/nova/nova/utils.py", line 66, in import_class
    raise exception.ClassNotFound(class_name=class_str)
nova.exception.ClassNotFound: Class Client could not be found

This does not help the user, since it indicates the class Client cannot be
found, even if it is actually found but fail to import.

With this commit, the error message is better:
nova-manage
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./bin/nova-manage", line 84, in <module>
    from nova import image
  File "/home/jd/Work/src/nova/nova/image/__init__.py", line 22, in <module>
    from nova.image import glance
  File "/home/jd/Work/src/nova/nova/image/glance.py", line 42, in <module>
    GlanceClient = utils.import_class('glance.client.Client')
  File "/home/jd/Work/src/nova/nova/utils.py", line 66, in import_class
    raise exception.ClassNotFound(class_name=class_str, exception=exc)
nova.exception.ClassNotFound: Class Client could not be found: No module named kombu.connection

This helps to know that in this kombu is missing.

It would probably even better to rename ClassNotFound to
ClassCannotBeImported or something like that too.

(cherry picked from commit 33e58925c75b66c6800d3ba6068ee1e4f0db6617)

Change-Id: I50c591b54820ae734e5d1dccedf6653c5c9d40f9
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien.danjou@enovance.com>

commit_message:
Remove 'location' from POST/PUT image responses

The 'location' field is already removed from GET calls, so we should
also remove it from POST/PUT operations. Partially fixes bug 880910.

Change-Id: I4f7d8d0309c8a3e10d0c2a99573ca0fa808c93be

commit_message:
Speed up test suite by 20 seconds

Change openstack API server actions test to use controller directly,
bypassing WSGI layer. This shaves up to half a second off each test and
can speed up test suite by 20 seconds.

Change-Id: Ideadbeef2232753eae628d0ffdd534055f1dbc40

commit_message:
Revised documentation build process (bug #843056)

- Manual method now produces docs in the same location as setup.py
- Added manual command to build man pages
- Manual method is now executable from the project root
  - To conform with similar commands
- Generated sourcecode rst's are now ignored by git
- Removed unused gitignore entries related to docs

Change-Id: I86fb38cdee957f5ba6717e1438494c7a148f4855

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-10-25 11:00:53.000000000', 'message': 'Handle pidfile exception for dnsmasq

Capture the exception in dnsmasq_pid_for method. If the pidfile cannot be read
for some reason, it should be treated as if it does not exist. This prevents
issues where the filesystem write delay leaves the file created but empty.
Fixes bug 865399.

(cherry picked from commit a25f106c2f824d7d03bf1161da72f66fe4be5a9c)

Change-Id: Ifd79c7143060702bfe359f0e0a35867c685e27df
'}]
commit_message:
Handle pidfile exception for dnsmasq

Capture the exception in dnsmasq_pid_for method. If the pidfile cannot be read
for some reason, it should be treated as if it does not exist. This prevents
issues where the filesystem write delay leaves the file created but empty.
Fixes bug 865399.

(cherry picked from commit a25f106c2f824d7d03bf1161da72f66fe4be5a9c)

Change-Id: Ifd79c7143060702bfe359f0e0a35867c685e27df

commit_message:
Stop returning correct password on api calls

Captured invalid signature exception in authentication step, so that
the problem is not returning exception to user, revealing the real
password.
Fixes bug 868360.

(cherry picked from commit beee11edbfdd82cd81bc9c0fd75912c167892c2b)

Change-Id: I5d6f713358dc720514b3e693f9adb11ccacecdd0

even if qemu-img fails. Fixes bug 861582.

subject: Update Admn doc 	Remove LocalImageService references 	use_deprecated_auth flag update Fixes bug 860473 Fixes bug 804099
messages:
[{'account_id': 964, 'date': '2011-10-22 15:01:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm pretty sure that the default for --use_deprecated_auth is set to true, what makes you think differently? 

All the Glance stuff looks good though."}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2011-10-22 16:11:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Razique is right on, --use_deprecated_auth is defaulting to False in nova trunk (as of Vish's checkin Aug 23rd).

We shouldn't be speaking of "Diablo" as a thing, even though we think about it that way often enough. In your section on 'Configuring Image Service...', you lead off with "Diablo uses...", where that would be a bit better as "Nova or OpenStack Compute uses..." - that makes it generic to future releases.

Change that wording, and I think you're set!'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2011-10-22 17:28:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Ah, okay, thanks for clarifying. I need to set up a separate branch for Diablo-based docs, then. Right now these publish to both /diablo and /trunk. 

Let me do that next week. Over and out!'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2011-10-26 14:55:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, approved

Okay, since this goes to the master branch I can approve and build it.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-10-26 14:56:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build Started https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/openstack-manuals/31/ '}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-10-26 14:56:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/openstack-manuals/31/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-10-26 14:56:08.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
Improve the liveness checking for services

With this modification both nova-manage and scheduler use the flag
service_down_time and check positive and negative values in a
correct way.
Fixes bug: 867674.

Change-Id: I15c48d80cafa2089cd228c09c61b0a1e513730e8

[{'created': '2011-10-24 21:58:42.000000000', 'message': 'Fix concurrency of XenAPI sessions

Fixes bug 879044

Nova currently does not serialize access to the XenAPI session which can
result in multiple (green)threads trying to use the same HTTP connection.
This will typically only affect Python 2.7 which has updated xmlrpclib to
try to use one HTTP connection for multiple requests.

Change-Id: I101d63b822c8bf8c28674a836e4b54aa8259e1a8
'}, {'created': '2011-10-24 22:43:37.000000000', 'message': 'Fix concurrency of XenAPI sessions

Nova currently does not serialize access to the XenAPI session which can
result in multiple (green)threads trying to use the same HTTP connection.
This will typically only affect Python 2.7 which has updated xmlrpclib to

Change-Id: I101d63b822c8bf8c28674a836e4b54aa8259e1a8
'}]
commit_message:
Fix concurrency of XenAPI sessions

Fixes bug 879044

Nova currently does not serialize access to the XenAPI session which can
result in multiple (green)threads trying to use the same HTTP connection.
This will typically only affect Python 2.7 which has updated xmlrpclib to
try to use one HTTP connection for multiple requests.

Change-Id: I101d63b822c8bf8c28674a836e4b54aa8259e1a8

'}]
commit_message:
venv: update distribute as well as pip

When you create a virtualenv, pip and setuptools/distribute is
installed.

When we later run install_venv.py to update the venv, we should
be sure to grab the latest versions of pip and distribute otherwise
issues like this one are masked:

  http://code.google.com/p/sqlalchemy-migrate/issues/detail?id=131

Change-Id: Id206be478ea6c5216dcee6f2f58dc91858c843f5

Because of a recent distribute update, pip installing
sqlalchemy-migrate is failing:

  http://code.google.com/p/sqlalchemy-migrate/issues/detail?id=131

As a workaround until the issue is resolved, we can explicitly
version the dependency.

Thanks to Derek Higgins for doing the debugging on this one.

Change-Id: I42bb69a91e34e6136da775dd596c65fa51658ce3
'}]
commit_message:
venv: explicitly version the sqlalchemy-migrate dep

Because of a recent distribute update, pip installing
sqlalchemy-migrate is failing:

  http://code.google.com/p/sqlalchemy-migrate/issues/detail?id=131

As a workaround until the issue is resolved, we can explicitly
version the dependency.

Thanks to Derek Higgins for doing the debugging on this one.

Change-Id: I42bb69a91e34e6136da775dd596c65fa51658ce3

commit_message:
Improve access check on images

Makes sure that users can delete only their own images, snapshots.
Enable listing of all images, both private which are owned and the public
ones. Only list the private images/snapshots for the owner and admin users.
Fixes bug 863305

Change-Id: I7326ec4a99158c8db5319f2397c99c5a89be2cb5

commit_message:
bug lp845714

Kind of fixes it, this calls resize on the instance. The space will be
available, but the partition won't be resized to use this space.
Running fdisk -l will show the additional space(after a discussion here
I was told this solution was best for the moment).

Adding myself to Authors

(cherry picked from commit 2dd0445dd60e5f0e845c49adbfb81acbebfc3ea8)

Change-Id: I563bb92934445799892e1064a78c1c7e29a7237c

commit_message:
Enforce snapshot cleanup.

Makes sure that the snapshot and the temporary directory is cleaned up,
even if qemu-img fails. Fixes bug 861582.

(cherry picked from commit eb6432361ee4946d93867e2d3f0870d892a25c66)

Change-Id: I718021bfb7069c39a47e0da25d79acbf07f02a69

subject: Fixed bug lp850602. Adding backing file copy operation on kvm block migration.
messages:
[{'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2011-10-19 16:35:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Bug is tagged with diablo-backport. Without this, block migration is basically broken.

The fix is quite invasive, but since it mostly just affects functionality that is broken without it, it seems safe enough.

Fedora has been carrying the fix. It's been in master for a while. There doesn't appear to have been problems with it."}, {'account_id': 24, 'date': '2011-10-21 16:02:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

subject: Snapshots/backups can no longer happen simultaneously. Tests included.
messages:
[{'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2011-10-19 16:34:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Not clear on how bad the consequences of simultaneous snapshots/backups, but it sounds bad.

Fix isn't too intrusive. The instance's task state is checked and 409 returned if one is in progress. Tests included. In master for a while with no apparent issues."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-10-19 17:46:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-10-19 16:32:44.000000000', 'message': 'Snapshots/backups can no longer happen simultaneously. Tests included.

Implemented exception.InstanceBusy when attempting to snapshot/backup an
instance which is already snapshotting or being currently backed up.

Fixes bug 727502.

(Patch Set 2) 3 new exceptions: InstanceBusy, InstanceSnapshotting, and InstanceBackingUp
(Patch Set 3) Oops. New exceptions now inherit from InstanceBusy
(Patch Set 4) Tests now tear down created instances

(cherry picked from commit b5abd8e7415c28630852107da7755045f6522b50)

Change-Id: I42a04254bd96d5f7a92b71a5d3e79f0350bbda5b

instance which is already snapshotting or being currently backed up.

Fixes bug 727502.

(Patch Set 2) 3 new exceptions: InstanceBusy, InstanceSnapshotting, and InstanceBackingUp
(Patch Set 3) Oops. New exceptions now inherit from InstanceBusy
(Patch Set 4) Tests now tear down created instances

(cherry picked from commit b5abd8e7415c28630852107da7755045f6522b50)

Change-Id: I42a04254bd96d5f7a92b71a5d3e79f0350bbda5b
'}]
commit_message:
Snapshots/backups can no longer happen simultaneously. Tests included.

Implemented exception.InstanceBusy when attempting to snapshot/backup an
instance which is already snapshotting or being currently backed up.

Fixes bug 727502.

(Patch Set 2) 3 new exceptions: InstanceBusy, InstanceSnapshotting, and InstanceBackingUp
(Patch Set 3) Oops. New exceptions now inherit from InstanceBusy
(Patch Set 4) Tests now tear down created instances

(cherry picked from commit b5abd8e7415c28630852107da7755045f6522b50)

Change-Id: I42a04254bd96d5f7a92b71a5d3e79f0350bbda5b

Add the ability to specify multiple extension directories

This allows for a colon-separated list of extension directories that will be
loaded at startup.

subject: Add .gitreview config file for gerrit.
messages:
[{'account_id': 1, 'date': '2011-10-25 03:41:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2011-10-25 03:41:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

We want to deprecate and remove rfc.sh because it is _very_ difficult to maintain across repositories, and since it's the workflow tool we're recommending, it should really behave the same across all of them.  We also don't want SCM scripts in the repos if we can help it.  Git-review handles everything rfc.sh does, including the change-id hook and adding the gerrit remote, and adds some new features too.  New users can pip install it, and it will be openstack independent, so we hope to promote its use in other projects to."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-10-25 03:41:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build Started https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/quantum-pep8/35/ (2/2)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-10-25 03:41:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build Started https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/quantum/61/ (1/2)'}, {'account_id': 233, 'date': '2011-10-25 03:41:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, approved

'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2011-10-25 03:41:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Hi James, 

While I agree on the value of this patch, I'd like to understand the reason for which we shall deprecate rfc.sh. 
Would the addition of the gerrit remote and the hook for the commit message become unnecessary?"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-10-25 03:41:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/quantum/61/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/quantum-pep8/35/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-10-25 03:41:19.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

The CI team is developing a new tool, git-review:

  https://github.com/openstack-ci/git-review

which is intendend to replace rfc.sh.  This adds a .gitreview file
so that it can automatically determine the canonical gerrit location
for the repository when first run.  Later, rfc.sh will be updated to
indicate it is deprecated, and then eventually removed.

Change-Id: I49edfa303671de58f54eae4e1d7c27916c41dda7
'}, {'created': '2011-10-25 03:41:19.000000000', 'message': 'Add .gitreview config file for gerrit.

Change-Id: I49edfa303671de58f54eae4e1d7c27916c41dda7
'}]
commit_message:
Add .gitreview config file for gerrit.

The CI team is developing a new tool, git-review:

  https://github.com/openstack-ci/git-review

which is intendend to replace rfc.sh.  This adds a .gitreview file
so that it can automatically determine the canonical gerrit location
for the repository when first run.  Later, rfc.sh will be updated to
indicate it is deprecated, and then eventually removed.

Change-Id: I49edfa303671de58f54eae4e1d7c27916c41dda7

commit_message:
Removed 'mox==0.5.0' and replaced with just 'mox' in tools/pip-requires.

I was getting an error from pip stating: Could not find a version that
satisfies the requirement mox==0.5.0 (from versions: ).

Potentially pip is messed up, but all tests seem to run with the latest
version of mox (0.5.3).

Change-Id: Id6a38766290a20d752177e8d272284b7b632156b

messages:
[{'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-09-15 23:22:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Finally, after having "git rebase" helpfully discard a couple
of my *checked in* changes.'}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-09-16 14:51:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

I hesitate to give this a -1 (because I really don't think the text that goes along with it is very apt), but I have a couple of comments:

The use of isinstance screams to me that either all properties should be objects (+1) or there should be a separate interface for adding properties to an image. Currently, as you point out, image_create() gets passed a dictionary of properties. If all properties are not objects then it's being passed a dictionary of mixed-types which in my opinion isn't ideal.

I don't know exactly how it might be accomplished but the other way, creating a separate interface for adding properties, would be more invasive. image_create(values) would be replaced with image_add_property(key, value, protected=False) or something of that nature.

All-in-all I don't want to hold up this change due to my dislike for isinstance() :)

Secondly, I think the migrations in Glance are getting a little out of hand due to some history and copy/paste... we should be able to add a column with a lot less code than we currently do:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/2459/


Lastly, I'd love for bugs/blueprints to be made from the large block comments, that way they're more visible and can be better prioritized."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-09-16 15:13:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

Could you explain what you mean by "because I really don't think the text that goes along with it is very apt"?

I agree that the isinstance() stuff screams "hack".  Personally, I'd prefer to go the route of having a separate interface for manipulating properties, but it's the invasiveness of that that kept me from doing it this time.

And +1 on the verbosity of the migrations!

Finally, I intend to open appropriate bugs/stories once this merge goes through for fixing the interface; I didn't want to do it before the merge because who knows what feedback I might get :)'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-09-16 16:50:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

re: the migration files, yeah, totally agree. Doing a more thorough review now.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-09-18 01:25:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I would like to suggest a few things:

1) I don't see the need to add another file for the tests. Can't those just live in glance/tests/functional/test_api.py?

2) I definitely support what Lamar said about the isinstance calls. I would suggest changing the interface of image_create (and any others that take image property dicts). Perhaps they could accept a list of dicts?

3) Can you call the header 'X-Image-Meta-Protected-Property? That way, people can still use 'protected' as the first word of their property name."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-09-19 13:27:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

After reviewing this more fully on Friday, I think I would prefer a simpler, less error prone implementation. Long-term, I think that image properties need to be handled in such a way that they are a full-fledged subresource. I added a design summit session and blueprint for this:

http://summit.openstack.org/sessions/view/48
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/glance/+spec/image-properties-refactor

Short-term, however, I think that it would be better to implement this using the following implementation:

1) Add an optional configuration variable called system_user that is set to the user/tenant of the "system". This would likely be "nova" for the use cases described for protected-properties.

2) Add an owner_id column to the ImageProperty model/table.

3) Use the user authentication system and context middleware to determine what user/tenant is adding a property. Follow these rules:

 a) If the property does NOT already exist, add it, setting the owner_id column of the ImageProperty to the user/tenant of the request context.
 b) If the property ALREADY EXISTS, then do the following:
  1. If the user/tenant is the system user/tenant, overwrite whatever was in the record and set the owner_id to the system user/tenant.
  2. If the user/tenant is NOT the system user/tenant, return a 403 Forbidden

4) When retrieving image properties through the client for a call to /images/<ID> or /images/detail, return all properties along with a flag for whether the property is a system property (its owner_id = system_user configuration value)

I think this would avoid some of the problematic code in this particular implementation and allow the use cases to be fulfilled in a simple way until we can add a true properties subresource to the 2.0 API.

Thoughts?
-jay'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-09-19 15:33:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The basic problem that I'm trying to solve here is that there should be properties that users cannot set, i.e., a property like "rackspace-certified".  I started off with a system property approach, but I received pushback from Glen to the effect that naive users could be tricked by _user_ properties having the same name as the _system_ property.  Then Glen spoke with Jay, and said you had agreed with an approach where protected properties could be listed in a configuration file, which is what I have attempted to implement here (with full knowledge that I was accumulating some technical debt which would need to be addressed at some point).

What you're saying now seems to contradict the property that caused me to scrap my previous work: as I read what you say, a consequence would seem to be that users can again set properties with the same name as a protected property, potentially misleading naive users.  Is this correct?

(Incidentally, "protected properties" is a feature that Rackspace has marked as "essential," and we also have a deadline which occurs before the conference (which, by the way, I will not be able to attend).  So, I either need to come up with an implementation that is acceptable before then or somehow convince Glen that we can put it off until after the conference...)'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-14 18:48:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Kevin and Jay: Do we need to regroup here and talk about what we discussed at the conference?'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-10-14 18:54:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

If this was discussed at the conference, then yes, we probably should (and we should probably include glenc in that conversation as well).'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-10-24 20:52:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Abandoning for superior v2.0 API approach'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2011-09-15 23:21:30.000000000', 'message': 'Add protected properties

Adds the concept of "protected" properties to glance.  A "protected"
property is a property that 1) has a default value, and 2) cannot be
set by users, only by glance admins.  This allows cloud providers to
provide a "certified" property that malicious users cannot spoof.

Change-Id: I94146d74f2f2434f19330d4c2406ef9d7acd337e
'}]
commit_message:
Add protected properties

Adds the concept of "protected" properties to glance.  A "protected"
property is a property that 1) has a default value, and 2) cannot be
set by users, only by glance admins.  This allows cloud providers to
provide a "certified" property that malicious users cannot spoof.

Change-Id: I94146d74f2f2434f19330d4c2406ef9d7acd337e

subject: Use UUIDs instead of IDs for OSAPI servers.
messages:
[{'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-10-19 21:35:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(4 inline comments)

Awesome.  Love this.  Few things inline.  Really wonder if we shouldn't just remove the integer ID support now.  Rip off the band-aid.  I don't see that people would be accessing integer ID now that it's not exposed at all."}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2011-10-20 14:03:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2011-10-20 14:12:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

Are you asking that we remove ID support just from the OSAPI? or from the compute and db layers as well?

Assuming that you just mean the OSAPI, I'm with you--but the way I'm looking at it I guess I want the OSAPI to be agnostic about what an ID is. So what I would do to push it further in that case is remove the little support I added to the server actions createImage and createBackup.

Does any of that make sense? Thanks for having a look."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-10-20 17:40:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

Replied to your question inline in Patch Set 1 (volumes.py).

I was definitely thinking OS API only.  Agree with OSAPI being agnostic about what an 'id' is.  It'd be nice to not add any more "is_uuid_like" calls.  And yeah, those 2 sections of code you reference is what I was thinking about.'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2011-10-20 18:56:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2011-10-20 18:58:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Okay, got it. I made the changes you suggested, Christopher.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-10-20 19:02:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Use UUIDs instead of IDs for OSAPI servers.

Continues to support both UUIDs and IDs in the compute and db layers,
but only exposes UUIDs in the ID fields of OSAPI responses. Technically,
old ID-based URIs still work, but you likely can't find them any longer.
This only affects servers--images and flavors still use integer IDs.

Fixes bug 804093

Change-Id: Iecf25c5402f355dd3f227b87a936fcc1b81371b6

messages:
[{'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2011-10-20 05:21:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Cool stuff. Looks good

commit_message:
Convert instancetype.flavorid to string

Fixes bug 861666. This also removes some direct database access
in favor of using nova.compute.instance_types throughout the code.

Change-Id: I572cc19454fa76f435f5672d3d6e7ed55c8817da

commit_message:
Fixing bug with x-trans-id.  Will now be set on all incoming requests to proxy and trans-ids will not be reused.

Change-Id: Ieb59cadd9925a122566c98374b9736e77d3f98dd

subject: updating keystone developer documentation updating docstrings to remove errors in automodule generation updating setup.py to generate source documentation blueprint keystone-documentation bug 843056
messages:
[{'account_id': 6, 'date': '2011-10-21 00:23:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Per IRC conversation - this is a first cut for some initial Keystone documentation - is NOT intended to be complete. Looking for feedback from Keystone developers (Dolph, Ziad, Yoge...) as to accuracy of the documentation so I can make it better.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2011-10-21 16:09:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This is the same goal I was planning on working towards over the next couple days.

Specifically, I've cleaned up the README a bit recently, with the end-goal being that everything after the new "Questions/Feedback" section be moved to rst & published on http://keystone.openstack.org/

If you have any more progress on this, update the review and let's get it in. I think this is a great step in the right direction, minus 10 new sphinx_build warnings :P'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2011-10-21 20:37:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2011-10-21 20:48:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2011-10-21 21:13:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2011-10-21 21:16:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Significantly broader changes to the documentation - now includes generating documentation from all the docstrings as well. commit_message:
Contract changes to allow get and validate token calls to not have root of access, but have a root of token.
Fixing a minor bug.

messages:
[{'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2011-10-19 16:34:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Seems like a fairly serious issue with the OOM error handling in the Xen driver.

The fix looks fairly straightforward. It has been on trunk for a while with no reported issues.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-10-19 17:45:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

[{'created': '2011-10-19 16:32:37.000000000', 'message': "Raise InsufficientFreeMemory

Kind of fixes bug 851374 & bug 858679

Raises InsufficientFreeMemory if an instance can't
start because of that. This will cause the normal
instance failure recovery to catch this problem,
set the state, and log the error. This also
removes instance_set_state from db/api.py as that
was causing these exceptions in the first place.

(cherry picked from commit 7dba1d9aa989760b190f1cf3bad2ed22bb2e2fc5)

Change-Id: I93d4e3e2c264f520c0cd37c778a0db42eeb8345d
"}]
commit_message:
Raise InsufficientFreeMemory

Kind of fixes bug 851374 & bug 858679

Raises InsufficientFreeMemory if an instance can't
start because of that. This will cause the normal
instance failure recovery to catch this problem,
set the state, and log the error. This also
removes instance_set_state from db/api.py as that
was causing these exceptions in the first place.

(cherry picked from commit 7dba1d9aa989760b190f1cf3bad2ed22bb2e2fc5)

Change-Id: I93d4e3e2c264f520c0cd37c778a0db42eeb8345d

subject: Refactoring of extensions
messages:
[{'account_id': 642, 'date': '2011-10-20 22:41:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(2 inline comments)

Maybe nit-picky, but the more efficient means of concatting strings in Python is to use the join() method on strings, or
to use the string inference methods of python

Instances like:

45  +            relpkg = '.' + '.'.join(relpath.split(os.sep)) + '.'

56  +            classname = (__package__ + relpkg + root + '.' + 
57  +                         root[0].upper() + root[1:])

73  +            ext_name = __package__ + relpkg + dname + '.extension'

Seem to warrant either some join()ing or "%s" % (some vars), or even some "%(relpkg)" % locals()

Other comments inline'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-10-20 23:03:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

Fair enough on the string concatenation comments.  I'll come up with better ways--probably "%s" substitutions for most, and maybe .join() on the class name synthesis'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-10-20 23:07:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-10-21 16:51:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

Two silly-minor docstring violations. Looks great though, nice refactor.'}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2011-10-21 16:58:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Refactoring of extensions

of Python idioms and improved support for loading extensions.

subject: Migration 055: Adds indexes on `instances` to uuid, reservation_id, display_name and power_state.
messages:
[{'account_id': 209, 'date': '2011-10-20 20:03:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2011-10-20 20:07:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-10-20 22:11:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I don't think we should be adding migration files for database optimization... what works for some doesn't work for other installations with different data querying patterns. This is more DBA work.

Now, adding unique indexes that enforce *constraints* on data is another thing entirely, but I don't agree we should be doing a DBA's work in trying to prematurely predict which columns need indexes for performance reasons...

-jay"}, {'account_id': 209, 'date': '2011-10-21 16:11:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned'}]

Fixes bug 845847.

Change-Id: I6aaa22a5f640defa79bd6518687cd94085ae8201
'}]

Fixes bug 845847.

Change-Id: I6aaa22a5f640defa79bd6518687cd94085ae8201

subject: Revert how APIs get IP address info for instances
messages: [{'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-10-21 15:01:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned\n\nbroke tests at last minute.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2011-10-21 07:36:14.000000000', 'message': "Revert how APIs get IP address info for instances

Fixes bug 862839

listing instances with IPs is extremely inefficient after changes were
made to query the network manager for IP information for each instance.
I tried adding a network manager call that said 'give me IP information
for 'x' instances', but that was also too slow.

We need a solution that caches IP info from the network manager before
we can fully untie things.  So, this reverts APIs to use
instance['fixed_ips'] which hasn't been untied in the DB yet.

Change-Id: I39772ce9b2dade69ca27c345ad84cba87ea82976
"}]
commit_message:
Revert how APIs get IP address info for instances

Fixes bug 862839

listing instances with IPs is extremely inefficient after changes were
made to query the network manager for IP information for each instance.
I tried adding a network manager call that said 'give me IP information
for 'x' instances', but that was also too slow.

We need a solution that caches IP info from the network manager before
we can fully untie things.  So, this reverts APIs to use
instance['fixed_ips'] which hasn't been untied in the DB yet.

Change-Id: I39772ce9b2dade69ca27c345ad84cba87ea82976

commit_message:
Making TCP_KEEPIDLE socket option optional

Not all implementations of the python socket library support
TCP_KEEPIDLE, so only try to set it when supported. Fixes bug 879195.

Change-Id: I2f062a346a60c69f52d23f70332d7c9da4ecdf35

subject: Removing cache option from glance-api.conf
messages:
[{'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-10-20 19:47:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

That option is required and used by the cache middleware..."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-20 20:28:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

But it's also in glance-cache.conf. I couldn't really tell if the option in glance-api was used, but if so, we should consolidate them."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-10-20 22:16:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

We can't consolidate them, at least not in the current image cache design :(

The reason is that the middleware creates an image cache object, which needs the image_cache_datadir option. Also, the glance-cache-prefetcher, glance-cache-pruner, and glance-cache-reaper executables also create applications that instantiate an image cache object, and so they need to supply the image_cache_datadir option too.

I'm in the process of overhauling the prefetching/reaper/pruner stuff and also making the xattr requirement just a driver for the image cache (and making a non-xattr driver the default).

Bear with me. Should have it proposed in the next day or so."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-21 01:28:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ok, I don't mean to rush. It's just something I caught while deploying Glance today."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-21 01:29:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]

'}]

subject: Refactored version attributes
messages:
[{'account_id': 4, 'date': '2011-10-19 20:13:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

In bug 877504, I noticed that keystone was reporting itself as v0.9, which didn't make much sense. This patch addresses that.

Definitely open to discussion on how we should handle versioning going forward.

This patch attempts to blend keystone's existing approach to versioning with nova's bazaar-derived approach a bit, but mostly to follow OpenStack's named releases.

I'd like to use milestones (essex-m1-dev, essex-m1, ..., essex-rc, essex), but without something automated, we're obviously not going to keep that up to date... so the solution here is to simply use (essex-dev, essex)."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2011-10-20 18:24:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2011-10-20 19:39:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, approved

- Promoted the api version status from 'alpha' to 'beta'
- Adopted openstack release names in lieu of arbitrary version #'s

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-10-18 17:08:44.000000000', 'message': "Overhauls the image cache to be truly optional

Fixes LP Bug#874580 - keyerror 'location' when fetch errors
Fixes LP Bug#817570 - Make new image cache a true extension
Fixes LP Bug#872372 - Image cache has virtually no unit test coverage

* Adds unit tests for the image cache (coverage goes from 26% to 100%)
* Removes caching logic from the images controller and places it into
  a removeable transparent caching middleware
* Adds a functional test case that verifies caching of an image
  and subsequent cache hits
* Removes the image_cache_enabled configuration variable, since it's
  now enabled by simply including the cache in the application
  pipeline
* Adds a singular glance-cache.conf to etc/ that replaces the
  multiple glance-pruner.conf, glance-reaper.conf and
  glance-prefetcher.conf files

Change-Id: I58845871deee26f81ffabe1750adc472ce5b3797
"}, {'created': '2011-10-19 18:23:41.000000000', 'message': "Overhauls the image cache to be truly optional

TODO: Add documentation on the image cache utilities, like reaper,

Change-Id: I58845871deee26f81ffabe1750adc472ce5b3797
"}, {'created': '2011-10-19 20:35:43.000000000', 'message': "Overhauls the image cache to be truly optional

Fixes LP Bug#872372 - Image cache has virtually no unit test coverage

commit_message:
Overhauls the image cache to be truly optional

Fixes LP Bug#874580 - keyerror 'location' when fetch errors
Fixes LP Bug#817570 - Make new image cache a true extension
Fixes LP Bug#872372 - Image cache has virtually no unit test coverage

* Adds unit tests for the image cache (coverage goes from 26% to 100%)
* Removes caching logic from the images controller and places it into
  a removeable transparent caching middleware
* Adds a functional test case that verifies caching of an image
  and subsequent cache hits
* Removes the image_cache_enabled configuration variable, since it's
  now enabled by simply including the cache in the application
  pipeline
* Adds a singular glance-cache.conf to etc/ that replaces the
  multiple glance-pruner.conf, glance-reaper.conf and
  glance-prefetcher.conf files
* Adds documentation on enabling and configuring the image cache

TODO: Add documentation on the image cache utilities, like reaper,
      prefetcher, etc.

Change-Id: I58845871deee26f81ffabe1750adc472ce5b3797

commit_message:
Fixes LP Bug#844618 - SQLAlchemy errors not logged

Logs any import errors or SQLAlchemy connection failures
to the glance registry log so that there is some indication
that a driver module is not installed or there is a problem
with the sql_connection configuration string.

Adds test case that verifies log output and error raised.

Change-Id: Ib86c353350530d6de62e577df57602d1762879f9

subject: Add DHCP support to the QuantumManager and break apart dhcp/gateway
messages: [{'account_id': 233, 'date': '2011-10-20 06:03:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2011-10-20 05:49:45.000000000', 'message': 'Add DHCP support to the QuantumManager and break apart dhcp/gateway

This introduces a new flag "quantum_use_dhcp=<boolean>" which indicates whether
or not to enable dhcp for all of the networks.  If it is set then we start
dnsmasq (and provide it with the IP/MACs from Melange) similar to how this was
done in linux_net before.

Prior to this if you enabled dhcp then you would also get a gateway device..
some people may not want that so we now require that you specify the gateway
when creating the network in order to end up with a device that will act as a
gateway.  If you're using Melange IPAM and you don't specify the gateway you
still end up with one because it doesn't allow you to not have one.  This lays
the groundwork for the option of not having one in the future, at least :)

Change-Id: If709e4455320c998ec5d73e9ca1e427154986dea
'}]
commit_message:
Add DHCP support to the QuantumManager and break apart dhcp/gateway

This introduces a new flag "quantum_use_dhcp=<boolean>" which indicates whether
or not to enable dhcp for all of the networks.  If it is set then we start
dnsmasq (and provide it with the IP/MACs from Melange) similar to how this was
done in linux_net before.

Prior to this if you enabled dhcp then you would also get a gateway device..
some people may not want that so we now require that you specify the gateway
when creating the network in order to end up with a device that will act as a
gateway.  If you're using Melange IPAM and you don't specify the gateway you
still end up with one because it doesn't allow you to not have one.  This lays
the groundwork for the option of not having one in the future, at least :)

Change-Id: If709e4455320c998ec5d73e9ca1e427154986dea

subject: Change floating-snat to float-snat
messages: [{'account_id': 233, 'date': '2011-10-20 06:03:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2011-10-20 05:49:44.000000000', 'message': 'Change floating-snat to float-snat

With iptables v1.4.10 I'm running into an issue with the chain length of the
"nova-dhcpbridge-floating-snat" table (iptables it complaining that the name
is too long; 28 chars max).  This shortens the name of that table.

Change-Id: Ic4e275d26d66e3c8e18c477b0dd5a5e4a0e6bcfb
'}]
commit_message:
Change floating-snat to float-snat

With iptables v1.4.10 I'm running into an issue with the chain length of the
"nova-dhcpbridge-floating-snat" table (iptables it complaining that the name
is too long; 28 chars max).  This shortens the name of that table.

Change-Id: Ic4e275d26d66e3c8e18c477b0dd5a5e4a0e6bcfb

commit_message:
Change network delete to delete by uuid instead of cidr

With melange it will be possible to have overlapping cidrs so it would be
better to specify the uuid of the network to delete.

Change-Id: I48f28b4d1de1e8667ecdabbc37314fa160cea5c2

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-10-18 05:09:10.000000000', 'message': "Fix quantum/melange ipam interaction

We now query for the subnets by net_id/vif_id instead of searching through all
the blocks to find the right one.  Both of the allocate and deallocate for
instance calls are now using the vif_id -> network_id mapping instead of
searching the quantum networks.  get_port_by_attachment was also changed to
take a net_id so that we don't have to search through all of the quantum
networks to find the corresponding port.

Change-Id: I214b77bc352b89e8e2d11ebfca5421b0a4e0ecb1
"}]
commit_message:
Fix quantum/melange ipam interaction

We now query for the subnets by net_id/vif_id instead of searching through all
the blocks to find the right one.  Both of the allocate and deallocate for
instance calls are now using the vif_id -> network_id mapping instead of
searching the quantum networks.  get_port_by_attachment was also changed to
take a net_id so that we don't have to search through all of the quantum
networks to find the corresponding port.

Change-Id: I214b77bc352b89e8e2d11ebfca5421b0a4e0ecb1

I'm also a +1, but would like others to have a look before merging."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2011-10-17 13:54:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Hi Mark,

This doesn't smoke cleanly. I'm seeing the following UnboundLocalError exception when the 'nova manage db sync' command runs:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/2734/"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-10-17 14:46:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: No score

Hey Mark, I know that you put that hack in there to avoid optparse exiting on an unknown option, but really, why would we want to NOT exit on an unknown option? Shouldn't the program throw an error if someone is calling it incorrectly?"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2011-10-17 14:58:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Dan - thanks for catching that, I thought I'd tested that already. Will fix

Jay - the "ignore unknown options" think is the current behaviour. Various drivers define options when they're loaded at runtime so you don't want Nova to barf at startup on an option that will be valid later.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-10-17 16:05:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I understand that various drivers "load options at runtime", but I'm suggesting that they should not do so. Just like extensions have to declare what they support, in the ExtensionDescriptor class, I think drivers should declare what options they support statically...

Also, the larger argument remains regarding whether all the FLAGS in Nova should really be able to be set via command-line options. In all the other OpenStack projects, configuration files are used for the vast majority of program options, with only a small number of options configurable via command-line options...

-jay'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2011-10-17 16:51:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Jay, these are all good things to think about for the future ... but I don't see how it relates to this patch.

This patch is making a step towards optparse, by switching to it without requiring widespread changes to the rest of Nova. It's a stepping stone, not an endpoint."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-10-17 17:02:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sure, no worries, Mark. I was bringing it up because the hack you wrote to skip invalid options seems to be what is causing the test failure that Dan mentions. :)'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2011-10-18 11:10:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2011-10-18 11:12:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Okay, there was an issue where I was supporting gnu_getopt behaviour but we don't currently support it and nova-manage relies on not supporting it.

I've fixed that, I'm worried that dprince's issue actually looks like a python 2.6 bug - e.g. http://bugs.python.org/issue9563

Dan - could you retest?"}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2011-10-18 12:21:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hey Mark.

I'm still hitting the UnboundLocalError issue with revision 72a313d (patch set 2):

commit_message:
Start switching from gflags to optparse

Re-write the nova.flags module to use optparse instead of gflags.

This provides an easier path to switching completely to optparse.
Next steps are to:

  1) Gradually switch each of the individual flags to optparse

  2) Re-use config code from other projects via openstack-common

optparse was chosen instead of argparse purely because that's what
the other projects use and that's what makes most sense for
openstack-common. Switching to argparse is something that can be
done later in openstack-common.

Change-Id: Ia49d42b4c7cc208fba140db6b8fd8f33c0f89e04
