commit_message:
Catch exception when there are no fixed ips for an instance when deallocating it.

When trying to delete failed builds I got the following traces:

(nova.rpc): TRACE: Traceback (most recent call last):
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/nova/rpc/impl_kombu.py", line 620, in _process_data
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     rval = node_func(context=ctxt, **node_args)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/nova/network/manager.py", line 252, in deallocate_for_instance
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     fixed_ips = self.db.fixed_ip_get_by_instance(context, instance_id)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/nova/db/api.py", line 392, in fixed_ip_get_by_instance
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     return IMPL.fixed_ip_get_by_instance(context, instance_id)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py", line 120, in wrapper
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     return f(*args, **kwargs)
(nova.rpc): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py", line 877, in fixed_ip_get_by_instance
(nova.rpc): TRACE:     raise exception.FixedIpNotFoundForInstance(instance_id=instance_id)
(nova.rpc): TRACE: FixedIpNotFoundForInstance: Instance 37 has zero fixed ips.

Which this commit fixes.

Change-Id: I11ee14f20b9fa1285dc76baf6a1c7c7d8a94e375

subject: Repartition and resize disk when marked as managed.
messages:
[{'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-10-17 17:01:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Hey Rick, interesting stuff :)

a) Is there a blueprint/bug report for this?
b) Can we get some test cases?

Thanks!
-jay"}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2011-10-18 23:07:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2011-10-18 23:21:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Jay-

Thanks for the quick review.

I updated the commit message w/ the name of the associated bp (which this patch partially implements).

I added a few tests to ensure that partitioning is only performed when the instance is marked as managed and the virt-layer specific failsafes pass.'}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2011-10-19 15:37:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2011-10-19 16:45:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-10-19 17:53:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Thanks, Rick, tests look good :)

FYI, to trigger the state change in the blueprint automatically, you need to use this pattern to reference the blueprint in the commit message:

Implements blueprint instance-disk-management

There's a section on it here: http://wiki.openstack.org/GerritWorkflow#Committing_Changes

:)"}, {'account_id': 209, 'date': '2011-10-19 17:59:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, approved

commit_message:
Making run_test.sh python version and directory
agnostic

Refactored some of the shell scripts to handle
being run from another directory, as well as to
not force the use of 2.6

edit: format the comments

Change-Id: Id92b9dc82743598b7c570e431cad423c8a2ee95d

subject: Adding generic run_tests.sh
messages:
[{'account_id': 927, 'date': '2011-10-19 15:35:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Code looks fine.  Running into an issue when creating venv, thinks its just a directory structure issue.

westmaas@gabe-dev:~/projects/openstack-integration-tests$ ./run_tests.sh kong

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
./run_tests.sh
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
No virtual environment found...create one? (Y/n) y
python: can't open file 'tools/install_venv.py': [Errno 2] No such file or directory"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-10-19 15:35:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build Started https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/openstack-integration-tests-merge/1/ '}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-10-19 15:35:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Not quite sure I get where we're going with this... could you explain? Are we putting a run_tests.sh in every test suite directory?"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-10-19 15:35:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Gotcha, ok I can see the path forward now :) Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 927, 'date': '2011-10-19 15:35:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, approved

Thanks for updating that, looks good.'}, {'account_id': 1456, 'date': '2011-10-19 15:35:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Yes, the idea was to put a specific run_tests.sh into each directory to handle starting those specific tests. That would allow us to have the run_tests be completely agnostic and able to start test suites written an any language or framework, until they are all merged into one. This is meant to be a stopgap until everything is running under one suite.'}, {'account_id': 1456, 'date': '2011-10-19 15:35:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-10-19 15:35:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/openstack-integration-tests-merge/1/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-10-19 15:35:25.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
Improved CLI error feedback (bug 877504)

- Renamed 'commands' to 'actions' to avoid confusion
- Fixed: --help not showing usage options
- Fixed: lists of 'objects' and 'actions' were out of date
  - They are now generated at runtime

Change-Id: I055ae6c40d846efa3cea96f822aa6bec02afdfd2

[{'created': '2011-10-18 21:01:15.000000000', 'message': 'put fully qualified domain name in local-hostname

make metadata service return fully qualified domain name (fqdn) in
the local-hostname field. (bug 854614)

Also, move the dhcp_domain flag from being in nova.network.linux_net to be
in the more common nova.network.manager.  Since it is being used for
something more generic, it shouldnt be stuck in linux_net.

(cherry picked from commit 6415999523d26f1680265e5ca438020b7d6542c6)

Change-Id: I1cc9266ad197f603bb434d77d944e10a6f4e91ba
'}]
commit_message:
put fully qualified domain name in local-hostname

make metadata service return fully qualified domain name (fqdn) in
the local-hostname field. (bug 854614)

Also, move the dhcp_domain flag from being in nova.network.linux_net to be
in the more common nova.network.manager.  Since it is being used for
something more generic, it shouldnt be stuck in linux_net.

(cherry picked from commit 6415999523d26f1680265e5ca438020b7d6542c6)

Change-Id: I1cc9266ad197f603bb434d77d944e10a6f4e91ba

commit_message:
Makes sure to recreate gateway for moved ip

If nova moves an ip when setting up dhcp, make sure to reset
the default gateway.  Fixes bug 859587

(cherry picked from commit 569b310b003c1c96151a3e3d448ddf5fe4e9299a)

Change-Id: I6dd1fb9d80c9635a8a721e77386938684cdd8f53

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-10-18 22:13:03.000000000', 'message': "Don't leak exceptions out to users

Fixed bug 874472

Exceptions can contain all kinds of sensitive information, including
SQL queries (and arguments), configuration information and in some
cases the correct password (bug 868360). The information isn't useful
to users, so don't return potentially sensitive information. The
exceptions still get logged for debugging and troubleshooting purposes.

Change-Id: I97cc72aec4e83ce866169ed94146d911aa8f6a6a
"}]
commit_message:
Don't leak exceptions out to users

Fixed bug 874472

Exceptions can contain all kinds of sensitive information, including
SQL queries (and arguments), configuration information and in some
cases the correct password (bug 868360). The information isn't useful
to users, so don't return potentially sensitive information. The
exceptions still get logged for debugging and troubleshooting purposes.

Change-Id: I97cc72aec4e83ce866169ed94146d911aa8f6a6a

commit_message:
Chain up to superclass tearDown in ServerActionsTest

I noticed that HostTestCase was failing if run on its own because
allow_admin_api wasn't set - it worked fine when the full suite was
run because the flag was being leaked from ServerActionsTest.

Change-Id: I9072f84f017125536d1f261165c44413964f5708

[{'created': '2011-10-18 20:29:03.000000000', 'message': 'Fix EC2 test_cloud timing issues

Fixes bug 877661

Unfortunately, these tests are really integration tests.  Being that
they are, rpc.cast is now stubbed to do an rpc.call to ensure the
operations complete.  No need for sleeps anymore.

This also uncovers some other issues with the tests..  And it uncovers a
bug in the network API where a wrong argument is passed to destroy a
floating IP.

Change-Id: Ia7f40718533e450f00cd3e7d753ac65755c70588
'}]
commit_message:
Fix EC2 test_cloud timing issues

Fixes bug 877661

Unfortunately, these tests are really integration tests.  Being that
they are, rpc.cast is now stubbed to do an rpc.call to ensure the
operations complete.  No need for sleeps anymore.

This also uncovers some other issues with the tests..  And it uncovers a
bug in the network API where a wrong argument is passed to destroy a
floating IP.

Change-Id: Ia7f40718533e450f00cd3e7d753ac65755c70588

The environment should be controlled from the config
file. Testing that RabbitMQ works is the job of the
RabbitMQ tests.

commit_message:
Redirects requests from /v#.# to /v#.#/

Added an APIMapper to catch routemaps when the url is '' because routes.Mapper returns an error if this is the case but we want a redirect
Fixes bug 865585
Related to Routes issue: https://bitbucket.org/bbangert/routes/issue/37/mapper-and-false-url

Change-Id: I5bc7cbde25726b340e110a8e62499b47e25bc0cd

Change the plugin interface for the create calls to take a param dict

This allows the passing of arbitrary information to the plugin via the request
parameters (i.e. data extension)

[{'account_id': 475, 'date': '2011-08-09 22:16:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(1 inline comment)

Looks great, nice work.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2011-08-10 03:00:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Normally when I see SSL client support I see options for 3 things:

1) a client key
2) a client cert
3) a CA cert

Is there a reason we aren't supporting the CA certs for Glance SSL? Am I missing something?"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-08-10 04:21:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hey Dan, to be honest, I'm not an expert on SSL stuff and I did my best to figure out what was needed here. I could use your advice. Could you elaborate a bit more on what is needed on the CA part? Thanks much!
-jay"}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2011-08-10 12:03:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

A client key and cert would be used by the Glance client to help negotiate an SSL connection to a Glance Registry server which is performing SSL client auth.

A CA cert would allow the client to verify things up the certificate chain to ensure that it is talking to a trusted server.

If we were trying to support SSL verification both ways I would expect 3 new config parameters: client key, client cert, CA cert (which controls who this client trusts)'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-08-10 13:46:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-08-10 14:39:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(4 inline comments)

This looks great, Jay. Found a few things:"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-08-10 15:10:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (4 inline comments)

fixing up the few issues...'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-08-10 15:14:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-08-10 15:24:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-08-10 15:28:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Thanks, Jay. Looks good.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2011-08-10 15:33:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

So this is looking better.

Jay: one question I have for you is have you functionally tested this out? Have you run a Glance registry server under SSL and then used the Glance client updates in this branch to connect to it. We don't currently have any functional testing/plumbing that is really going to flex this code yet so I'm just wondering if you've given it a go at least once?"}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2011-08-16 21:01:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, approved

Looks good to me. Great work here, Jay.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-08-16 21:01:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

LGTM, nice work here Jay.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2011-09-13 14:48:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Have you kicked the tires on Glance SSL functionally? We don't have a lot of functional tests on it yet so it would be nice to know if at least one person has verified this code actually works."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-09-13 16:08:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hey Dan, I will rebase with master shortly.

As for functionally testing Glance with SSL, HP engineers have done some, yes. However, I would really appreciate some assistance from those who know SSL better to come up with ways to easily test SSL connections (client and server) with self-signed certs that are generated on the fly by the functional test case. Any and all help would be really appreciated!
-jay'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-09-13 19:26:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-09-13 19:26:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hey Jay,

Couple more things:

---

See my comments from Aug 10th. I'd still like to consider adding a 'ca_cert option' so that the client can validate it is talking to a trusted server? What we've currently got will allow the server to verify its talking to a trusted client but not the opposite.

---

I'd also prefer to use:

  registry_client_protocol=https

instead of:

  registry_client_use_ssl=True"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-09-16 19:07:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-09-19 20:39:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (6 inline comments)

commit_message:
Adds SSL configuration params to the client

* Adds SSL configuration params to all client classes
* Adds unit test for bad SSL client configuration
* Refactors the registry methods to no longer need
  configuration options passed, and to configure the
  registry client once, on images.Controller.__init__
* Adds glance-api.conf options for SSL support in
  registry client connections.
* Adds SSL CA file socket wrappers via a client auth
  HTTPS connection class
* Adds server SSL support, but not functional tests
  for SSL support yet. Still need to research self-signed
  cert generation for tests...
* Updates documentation for bind and startup options
* Adds functional test case for secure communication
  with API server stood up with SSL supprt. Note it is
  not very DRY. There is some DRY cleanup to do in the
  future...

TODO: Integrate options with bin/glance CLI tool

Change-Id: Ie9fcd36337cc93fd5beeabb9186ad5e93ae2a0f0

subject: Add XML templates.
messages:
[{'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-13 20:06:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (7 inline comments)

1) Can you movethe contents of xmltmpl.py into xmlutil.py?
2) See inline comments.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-10-13 20:31:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (7 inline comments)

I chose xmltmpl.py as a good scratch location for developing the templates--I actually did much of the initial development and testing of the idea outside the nova tree entirely.  I don't suppose there's any harm in moving it all into xmlutil.py, I'm just not sure I see the reason.  Could you go into your thinking on this?"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-14 18:42:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (6 inline comments)

> I chose xmltmpl.py as a good scratch location for developing the 
> templates--I actually did much of the initial development and testing 
> of the idea outside the nova tree entirely. I don't suppose there's any 
> harm in moving it all into xmlutil.py, I'm just not sure I see the 
> reason. Could you go into your thinking on this?

I don't see it necessary to have two xml-utility modules. xmlutil.py was there first, so that one wins."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-10-14 19:13:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (4 inline comments)

Re: your point about xmlutil.py: Fair enough...'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-14 19:18:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (3 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-10-14 19:33:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

See my comment on the make_flavor()/make_flavors() discussion.  Assuming my proposed solution meets your approval, this is my summary of the work I need to do:

* Merge xmltmpl.py into xmlutil.py

* In set() calls, allow value to default to be the same as the key

* Refactor make_*() functions to allow top-level element to be allocated by the caller

* Change FlavorsTemplate/FlavorsDetailedTemplate to MinimalFlavorsTemplate/FlavorsTemplate (pattern match across all similar constructions)

* Remove _request from ResponseSerializer.serialize_headers()

* Remove isinstance() check in ResponseSerializer.serialize_body()

* Develop lazy_serialization by having LazySerializationMiddleware add an attribute to the environment

Have I missed anything?'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-14 19:45:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

That list looks comprehensive to me.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-10-14 20:03:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

I think maybe we've hit on a minor misunderstanding of the function of make_flavor(); hopefully I've clarified what's actually going on :)  For now, I'm going to proceed on the basis that make_*() should be refactored to pull the top-level element creation out into the caller, along with all the other to-dos.  Look out for the next patch set!  :)"}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-10-14 21:42:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-17 17:23:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Looks good. Thanks for working through this with me, Kevin!'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-10-17 17:38:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

No problem :)'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-10-17 19:19:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-10-17 19:21:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Waldon's "nuke v1.0" patch went in, so rebased to trunk, resolved all conflicts and fixed all other errors. how to serialize an object into XML.  XML templates are split into
master and slave templates, and slave templates can be attached to
master templates to augment the serialization.  The expected use

commit_message:
Add XML templates.

Creates the concept of an XML template, which is a description of
how to serialize an object into XML.  XML templates are split into
master and slave templates, and slave templates can be attached to
master templates to augment the serialization.  The expected use
case is with extensions, allowing extensions to not only add data
to the object, but to also ensure that the new data gets
serialized into the output XML representation.

Also includes lazy serialization, for use by extensions.

Change-Id: Ifd8493be04c73bbb2a850080b687c5e799c48239

Utility script that makes enforcing PEP8 within git's pre-commit hook as easy as possible.

This should be mandatory for all developers, IMHO.

subject: Remove OSAPI v1.0
messages:
[{'account_id': 360, 'date': '2011-10-11 21:21:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not submit

I oppose removing the v1.0 API this early in the Essex release cycle for a couple reasons:

-the OSAPI v1.1 API is still a draft. It seems to me that we should have at least one stable OSAPI API before we remove older versions.

-I would really like to see us maintain v1.0 until a working (or work in progress) v1.2 or 2.0 comes into play. In that sense I think nova should try to support latest API version - 1 minor version.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-11 21:27:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> -the OSAPI v1.1 API is still a draft. It seems to me that we should have at 
> least one stable OSAPI API before we remove older versions.

I definitely agree that we should have a stable API. How about we call v1.1 final? It hasn't changed lately, and I feel like it has been unofficially stable for a while.

> -I would really like to see us maintain v1.0 until a working (or work in  
> progress) v1.2 or 2.0 comes into play. In that sense I think nova should try 
> to support latest API version - 1 minor version.

I disagree that we should support the latest -1 minor version. We should absolutely support latest -1 *major* version, while supporting the latest minor version within a major version of our API. v1.0 is somewhat of a special case as it is technically a minor version w.r.t. v1.1, yet it is functionally a major version. I want to get rid of it so we can move on."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-13 18:30:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-13 18:31:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Just rebased, no functional changes.'}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2011-10-13 18:46:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

lgtm ... I would like to see Brian & Dan resolve the timing issue through feats of strength or some form of arena battle.

One thing remaining though ... pep8:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/2710/"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-13 18:58:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-13 18:59:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Sandy: fixed pep8 errors. I think Dan is probably okay with this now that SmokeStack and the nova-vpc Jenkins job are getting updated. I'll let him comment on that."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-13 19:02:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-13 19:03:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Forgot to actually remove v1.0 from the 300 Multiple Choices output. Done now.'}, {'account_id': 209, 'date': '2011-10-13 19:28:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

subject: Better document using Glance with Keystone.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 34, 'name': 'Todd Willey', 'email': 'todd@ansolabs.com', 'username': 'xtoddx'}, {'_account_id': 112, 'name': 'Jesse Andrews', 'email': 'anotherjesse@gmail.com', 'username': 'anotherjesse'}, {'_account_id': 209, 'name': 'Josh Kearney', 'email': 'josh@jk0.org', 'username': 'jk0'}, {'_account_id': 679, 'name': 'Kevin L. Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 112, 'date': '2011-10-11 20:41:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Good docs, but I was under the impression that delayed_auth has issues currently?  If so should the docs notate that?'}, {'account_id': 34, 'date': '2011-10-11 20:51:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

delay_auth_decision isn't exactly the same as allowing anonymous access.  It lets bad credentials work, instead of just not requiring them.  If you want to enable anonymous, it would be better to change your pipeline in a more obvious way, such as removing filter:authtoken.  I haven't tested it though."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-10-11 20:56:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I was unaware of that.  I'll update to remove references to delay_auth_decision..."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-10-11 20:58:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-10-13 16:34:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Excellent documentation, Kevin. I only have a minor suggestion...

Would it be possible to rename [filter:authtoken] to [filter:auth-token] and rename [filter:keystone-shim] to [filter:auth-context]?

I think auth-context provides more of a description about what the filter is doing (adding a context object that reflects auth information to the pipeline).

Thoughts?
-jay'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-10-13 16:59:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I chose "authtoken" for consistency with nova, so I'm reluctant to change the name unless nova does.  (Of course, the names have relevance only within a single .conf, but still...)  I have no problem with renaming keystone_shim to auth-context, however...'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-10-13 17:03:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-10-13 17:13:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Fair enough. We can ask to make authtoken auth-token for consistency later on...'}, {'account_id': 209, 'date': '2011-10-17 17:37:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-10-17 17:37:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Build Started https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/glance-pep8/280/ (1/3)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-10-17 17:37:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Build Started https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/glance-merge/107/ (2/3)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-10-17 17:37:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Better document using Glance with Keystone.

Addresses bug 871803 by expounding on what configuration should
look like.  Also fixes the example config files, which generally
had the authentication setup completely wrong.

Change-Id: I44b2b8bd340ca95b5a2c2e9408797b0308000a65

commit_message:
fix pep8 issues in Cisco plugin

bug 875458

The cisco plugin has some pep8 errors when using pep8 version 0.6.1
which is now what is used to gate trunk.

This fix is not supposed to change any functionality.  I was not able
to test it, so I will need a review + testing from the Cisco team.

It was decided a while back that we should be keeping up with the latest version of dependencies in pip-requires in order to head-off problems before they get released to distributions (I *think* that was one of the reasons). Fedora 16 has SQLAlchemy-0.7.2 and it seems to work fine with Nova,
modulo these occassional migration errors that crop up. The
foreign_keys set in 047 issue is the third such problem fixed lately.

commit_message:
Use latest version of SQLAlchemy

Fedora 16 has SQLAlchemy-0.7.2 and it seems to work fine with Nova,
modulo these occassional migration errors that crop up. The
foreign_keys set in 047 issue is the third such problem fixed lately.

Is there any particular reason to stick with 0.6.3?

Change-Id: Ia65bc1f6035917b5aec84ad51d6504543256f7ca

subject: make drive audit regexes detect 4-letter drives
messages:
[{'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2011-10-03 16:14:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Seems fine, we'll get Chuck to check it out since he wrote the original I think. Not sure why the change from startswith to == but maybe he'll know if it matters."}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2011-10-14 16:01:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

lgtm

as gholt said, check should look at this too'}, {'account_id': 1534, 'date': '2011-10-14 16:23:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Looks good, following gholts note I ran some tests I assume the == to replace startswith is for performance?

very raw test:
------------


from time import time
print('Running 100000 itterations of startswith')
dev='sdb'

s = time()
for i in xrange(100000):
    if dev.startswith('sdb'):
        continue
e = time()
print('Completed in %2f' % (e-s))

print('Running 100000 itterations of ==')
s = time()
for i in xrange(100000):
    if dev == 'sdb':
        continue
e = time()
print('Completed in %2f' % (e-s))
-----

python ./test.py 
Running 100000 itterations of startswith
Completed in 0.040412
Running 100000 itterations of ==
Completed in 0.013661"}, {'account_id': 917, 'date': '2011-10-14 19:08:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, approved

Looks good to me.  Did some manual testing of the regexes and they look good.  Thanks redbo!'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-10-14 19:08:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Adds the ability to automatically issue a hard reboot to instances that have been stuck in a 'rebooting' state for longer than a specified window.

Fixes bug 873099.

Vek: You raise a good point about the ISO case, it won't conform to the standard device numbers that the other cases are using.

The issue with "fixing" this, is that whomever is using ISO may already be relying on CD being xvdc and not swap.

Since this won't break anything for them, I'd vote we merge this in as-is, and circle back around and try to find a sane way of handling both extra drives (probably moving CD to xvdd?).'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-10-14 18:23:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

subject: First commit for Secret Question and Answer Extension: RAX-KSQA
messages:
[{'account_id': 1322, 'date': '2011-10-12 22:49:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1322, 'date': '2011-10-13 22:26:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1322, 'date': '2011-10-13 22:33:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 8, 'date': '2011-10-14 02:16:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I would suggest the request to be a PUT rather then POST.

" The POST method is used to request that the origin server accept the entity enclosed in the request as a new subordinate of the resource identified by the Request-URI in the Request-Line" i.e. Create.

" The PUT method requests that the enclosed entity be stored under the supplied Request-URI. If the Request-URI refers to an already existing resource, the enclosed entity SHOULD be considered as a modified version of the one residing on the origin server. If the Request-URI does not point to an existing resource, and that URI is capable of being defined as a new resource by the requesting user agent, the origin server can create the resource with that URI." That is, a Create or an Update.

The actual resource is not auto generated ie the resouce id secretqa remains same .

XSD/ JSON everything looks good.

Ziad suggestion of having this as another type of credentials is also something to be explored.'}, {'account_id': 1322, 'date': '2011-10-14 15:00:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1322, 'date': '2011-10-14 16:20:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 8, 'date': '2011-10-14 16:54:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me, approved

commit_message:
Query only specific zone via swift-recon

Add support to query only specific zones, as well a --all shortcut flag to run all checks.
Also skip deleted devices when trying to grab hosts from the ring.

Change-Id: I441ec76c90857c2e74262a7a9e2d36de89b28631

commit_message:
Remove redundant, dead code.

not used; everything used VMHelper.get_vdi_for_vm_safely().

Everything else seems ok to me."}, {'account_id': 236, 'date': '2011-10-06 23:43:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-10-10 21:04:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(1 inline comment)

Minor thing.. looks like a line was left in that forced to always update bw.  See inline comment."}, {'account_id': 236, 'date': '2011-10-10 22:40:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 236, 'date': '2011-10-11 20:38:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 209, 'date': '2011-10-11 21:00:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2011-10-11 22:17:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

the bin should have the word nova in it?'}, {'account_id': 236, 'date': '2011-10-11 22:44:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

You mean the instance-usage-audit script? I don't see why. It's an ancillary script run from a cronjob, not a persistent process. Plus I am not adding it here, just refactoring. No need to break people's cronjobs by suddenly renaming things."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-10-12 16:34:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, approved

Jesse: I think we should rename that script later if we decide it should be renamed.  Separate issue from this bug.  lgtm.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-10-12 16:35:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Build Started https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova-merge/103/ (1/3)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-10-12 16:36:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Build Started https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova-pep8/1475/ (2/3)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-10-12 16:53:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Build Started https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova/121625/ (3/3)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-10-12 16:54:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Fails

Build Failed 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova-merge/103/ : This change was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of the repository. Please rebase your change and upload a new patchset. 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova-pep8/1475/ : FAILURE 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova/121625/ : FAILURE'}, {'account_id': 236, 'date': '2011-10-12 19:13:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-10-13 00:43:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2011-10-13 12:01:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I like most of this change - adding the bw_usage_cache table to the DB and passing the data usage_audit all looks very good.

The part I don't like is generating the data in the virtualisation layer, as I think that's a hard feature to make common across hypervisors - and bandwidth meterign is a key feature.

We have been looking at an alternative approach (currently just a manual PoC) of generating the data via an additional IPtables rule per VM - which would be hypervisor agnostic and allow configurtaion to exclude certain subnets (for example data to a co-hosted swift instance).  

My main concern its how we would add the IP tables approach on top of this change, as it doesn't feel like an alternative implementaion at the virtualisation layer.

More than happy to share details of how we belive the IPtables approach would work so it could be rolled into here."}, {'account_id': 236, 'date': '2011-10-13 15:31:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

All of the 'front end' code that actually generates the usage notifications pulls the bandwidth information from the bw cache table in the db. The only code that calls the virt layer to fetch bw info is the periodic task that updates the cache.  In the future, if another, more hypervisor agnostic solution is found to poll bandwidth, then that code can simply populate the cache table, and the notification code will continue to work as it had before. In the meantime, polling the hypervisor works for now."}, {'account_id': 335, 'date': '2011-10-13 20:45:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Looks good to me, approved

Phil,

I think the iptables logic would work, but that is a Linux only implementation which wouldn't work for Hyper-V. Also, this wouldn't work for people using OVS instead of iptables for host protections. As Dragon said, I think the solution can work for now until a better one is designed."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-10-13 20:45:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Build Started https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova-merge/128/ (1/3)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-10-13 20:45:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Build Started https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova-pep8/1500/ (2/3)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-10-13 20:46:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Build Started https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova/121650/ (3/3)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-10-13 20:56:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Verified

commit_message:
Adds more usage data to Nova's usage notifications.

Adds in bandwidth, state and IP data on standard notifications,
and new notifications on add/remove IP.

These were missing before, and are needed to meet spec.
This fixes bug 849117

Change-Id: Ie586ff3a91a56e5f5eff8abc6905ba6a0b624451

[{'created': '2011-10-13 18:09:48.000000000', 'message': "Additions to .gitignore

Installing or testing glance adds several files that are not currently
ignored by git, leading to cluttered displays of modified files.  This
causes the 'build', 'dist', and 'glance.egg-info' directories to be
ignored, reducing the clutter.

Change-Id: I3f0ca3f99fcf6cfe0480fbf5755908ee411552ea
"}]
commit_message:
Additions to .gitignore

Installing or testing glance adds several files that are not currently
ignored by git, leading to cluttered displays of modified files.  This
causes the 'build', 'dist', and 'glance.egg-info' directories to be
ignored, reducing the clutter.

Change-Id: I3f0ca3f99fcf6cfe0480fbf5755908ee411552ea

'}, {'created': '2011-10-13 07:47:30.000000000', 'message': 'Add INPUT chain rule for EC2 metadata requests (lp:856385)

On Fedora, the default policy for the INPUT chain in the filter table
is DROP. This means that EC2 metadata requests from guests get dropped.

Add this rule to let it through:

$> sudo iptables -t filter -A nova-network-INPUT \
                 -s 0.0.0.0/0 -d $ec2_dmz_host \

'}]
commit_message:
Add INPUT chain rule for EC2 metadata requests (lp:856385)

On Fedora, the default policy for the INPUT chain in the filter table
is DROP. This means that EC2 metadata requests from guests get dropped.

Add this rule to let it through:

$> sudo iptables -t filter -A nova-network-INPUT \
                 -s 0.0.0.0/0 -d $ec2_dmz_host \
                 -m tcp -p tcp --dport $ec2_port -j ACCEPT

It makes no sense to have nova-network add an iptables rule for the EC2
metadata service, since they may not actually be on the same host.

Instead, nova-api should add it directly. In order to do that, we add a
manager class for API services and allow the EC2 manager use the network
driver to add the rule.

Change-Id: I7c1f973c662a6d290e555b6a2ce8fc301f27b543

commit_message:
Remove VolumeDriver.sync_exec method (lp:819997)

We always use the same functions for sync_exec and execute.

The execute method is always synchronous, so the distinction doesn't
appear to make sense.

Finally, it looks like it would make sense for execute to ever be
async, so the distinction isn't even serving a useful documentation
purpose.

Change-Id: I86d491cfbf8be73672df7cfdf22e465627a86034

commit_message:
Allow the user to choose either ietadm or tgtadm (lp:819997)

Also, refactor ietadm/tgtadm calls out into helper classes. Add a new
TargetAdmin abstract base class and implement it using ietadm and
tgtadm. This cleans up the code greatly and gets us some code reuse.

(Based on a patch by Chuck Short <zulcss@ubuntu.com>)

Change-Id: I1c0064e5d35483a6c4059cfc61a484f5f576b2da

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-09-23 11:24:47.000000000', 'message': 'Add INPUT chain rule for EC2 metadata requests

On Fedora, the default policy for the INPUT chain in the filter table
is DROP. This means that EC2 metadata requests from guests get dropped.

Add this rule to let it through:

$> sudo iptables -t filter -A nova-network-INPUT \
                 -s 0.0.0.0/0 -d $ec2_dmz_host \
                 -m tcp -p tcp --dport $ec2_port -j ACCEPT

However, this only works if nova-network and nova-api are on the same
host.

Change-Id: Ic99ba9249ce5219cd2631184154add82d25d9d6d
'}, {'created': '2011-09-23 11:32:15.000000000', 'message': 'Add INPUT chain rule for EC2 metadata requests (lp:856385)

On Fedora, the default policy for the INPUT chain in the filter table
is DROP. This means that EC2 metadata requests from guests get dropped.

Add this rule to let it through:

$> sudo iptables -t filter -A nova-network-INPUT \
                 -s 0.0.0.0/0 -d $ec2_dmz_host \
                 -m tcp -p tcp --dport $ec2_port -j ACCEPT

However, this only works if nova-network and nova-api are on the same
host.

Change-Id: Ic99ba9249ce5219cd2631184154add82d25d9d6d
'}]
commit_message:
Add INPUT chain rule for EC2 metadata requests (lp:856385)

On Fedora, the default policy for the INPUT chain in the filter table
is DROP. This means that EC2 metadata requests from guests get dropped.

Add this rule to let it through:

$> sudo iptables -t filter -A nova-network-INPUT \
                 -s 0.0.0.0/0 -d $ec2_dmz_host \
                 -m tcp -p tcp --dport $ec2_port -j ACCEPT

However, this only works if nova-network and nova-api are on the same
host.

Change-Id: Ic99ba9249ce5219cd2631184154add82d25d9d6d

I was under the impression (based on an earlier edition of this patch) that the two commands had identical syntax. Since that's not the case, I wonder if this wouldn't be more elegantly achieved by two separate driver classes (one inheriting from the other or both inheriting from a common base class).

Failing that, I would really like to have the flag default to whichever of the two commands is actually present on the system (giving preference to the newer one, whichever one that is)."}, {'account_id': 518, 'date': '2011-10-11 10:09:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Hmm, I don't like just removing it without context. People will run the tests, things will fail and they'll add it back to pip-requires. 

Can we put comments in pip-requires (I looked at the docs and didn't see anything obvious)"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2011-09-29 17:54:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks for looking Sandy

The patch doesn't remove it - we just do a 'pip install M2Crypto' now, except on Fedora where use (and check) the system M2Crypto

Does that clarify?"}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2011-09-29 18:16:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-09-29 15:25:07.000000000', 'message': 'install_venv: pip install M2Crypto doesn't work on Fedora

... so use the system m2crypto library instead.

M2Crypto won't build on Fedora because of some bizarre differences with
Fedora's OpenSSL headers. I can get it to build by doing e.g.

 $> python ./tools/install_venv.py
 $> cd .nova-venv/build/M2Crypto
 $> for i in SWIG/_ec.i SWIG/_evp.i; do sed -i -e "s/opensslconf/opensslconf-x86_64/" $i ; done
 $> cd -
 $> SWIG_FEATURES=-cpperraswarn ./tools/with_venv.sh pip install M2Crypto

but that's clearly no fun. It should be fine to just use the system
version.

Change-Id: I94c7464bf60ae586e16a2f38b7440cea8dc110e5
'}]
commit_message:
install_venv: pip install M2Crypto doesn't work on Fedora

... so use the system m2crypto library instead.

M2Crypto won't build on Fedora because of some bizarre differences with
Fedora's OpenSSL headers. I can get it to build by doing e.g.

 $> python ./tools/install_venv.py
 $> cd .nova-venv/build/M2Crypto
 $> for i in SWIG/_ec.i SWIG/_evp.i; do sed -i -e "s/opensslconf/opensslconf-x86_64/" $i ; done
 $> cd -
 $> SWIG_FEATURES=-cpperraswarn ./tools/with_venv.sh pip install M2Crypto

but that's clearly no fun. It should be fine to just use the system
version.

Change-Id: I94c7464bf60ae586e16a2f38b7440cea8dc110e5

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-09-30 15:44:19.000000000', 'message': "Restructure host filtering to be easier to use.

The original design for host filtering in the scheduler required the entire
filtering process be contained in a single class; contrast this with the
design for weighting the hosts, which allowed you to specify a list of
functions that would apply various weighting factors to the hosts.

This commit modifies the filtering process to resemble the way that the
weighting process is designed. Filters can now be small, focused classes,
and you specify which filters to apply by setting the
'FLAGS.default_host_filters' flag to a list of the filter classes that
match your needs.

This is a port of the code from Launchpad, where it was orphaned:

https://code.launchpad.net/~ed-leafe/nova/scheduler-multifilter/+merge/72478

Change-Id: I5f3eff6f21409a9f0eddda3392e9ff9d03039ebe
"}, {'created': '2011-10-04 23:04:43.000000000', 'message': "Restructure host filtering to be easier to use.

The original design for host filtering in the scheduler required the
entire filtering process be contained in a single class; contrast this
with the design for weighting the hosts, which allowed you to specify
a list of functions that would apply various weighting factors to the
hosts.

This commit modifies the filtering process to resemble the way that
the weighting process is designed. Filters can now be small, focused
classes, and you specify which filters to apply by setting the
'FLAGS.default_host_filters' flag to a list of the filter classes
that match your needs.

This is a port of the code from Launchpad, where it was orphaned:

https://code.launchpad.net/~ed-leafe/nova/scheduler-multifilter/+merge/72478

Change-Id: I5f3eff6f21409a9f0eddda3392e9ff9d03039ebe
"}]
commit_message:
Restructure host filtering to be easier to use.

The original design for host filtering in the scheduler required the
entire filtering process be contained in a single class; contrast this
with the design for weighting the hosts, which allowed you to specify
a list of functions that would apply various weighting factors to the
hosts.

This commit modifies the filtering process to resemble the way that
the weighting process is designed. Filters can now be small, focused
classes, and you specify which filters to apply by setting the
'FLAGS.default_host_filters' flag to a list of the filter classes
that match your needs.

This is a port of the code from Launchpad, where it was orphaned:

https://code.launchpad.net/~ed-leafe/nova/scheduler-multifilter/+merge/72478

Change-Id: I5f3eff6f21409a9f0eddda3392e9ff9d03039ebe

[{'created': '2011-10-07 15:10:04.000000000', 'message': 'Fix possible_topdir computing

Using sys.argv[0] is wrong: if you run /usr/bin/keystone, it will look for

commit_message:
Fix possible_topdir computing

Using sys.argv[0] is wrong: if you run /usr/bin/keystone, it will look for
templates in /usr/keystone/ which will not work. The template path is
relative to the version.py file, so using __file__ makes things work.

Change-Id: I90e930bbb320b148df0fb7234a824b3644bd7369
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien.danjou@enovance.com>

subject: Update EC2 get_metadata calls to search 'deleted': False. Fixes nova smoke_tests!!!
messages:
[{'account_id': 961, 'date': '2011-10-12 15:31:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Looks good to me Dan.'}, {'account_id': 34, 'date': '2011-10-12 15:45:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I think compute_api.get_all should have a deleted=False filter as default.

The only place we would need to change behavior to explicitly set deleted=True is in nova/api/openstack/servers.py

There appear to be bugs in VSA code because of not passing deleted as well.  (nova/api/openstack/contrib/virtual_storage_arrays.py and nova/vsa/api.py)

If you disagree, I could also be convinced that documenting the behavior in the docstring for compute_api.get_all would be fine, instead of having it hidden in db.instance_get_all_by_filers."}, {'account_id': 1082, 'date': '2011-10-12 16:02:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I'm curious about 2 things
a.) what failure were you seeing ?
b.) is there a way you could tune that query even more?
  I'd think you could further filter on the fact that this instance is running (as something from inside it is doing an MD query).

I ask 'b' because the ec2 metadata service is terribly slow.  On a cloud i have access to which has run ~ 2300 instances, we're seeing 'python -c "import boto.utils; boto.utils.get_instance_meatadata())"' take 30 seconds. and a single GET (http://169.254.169.254/2009-04-04/meta-data/ami-id) taking over 1 second.

I'm guessing/hoping that this change would reduce that time by making the query more efficient.'}, {'account_id': 34, 'date': '2011-10-12 16:04:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Scott, I've been working on the general metadata slowness issue: https://review.openstack.org/#change,809"}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-10-12 16:25:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

This bug is separate from the slowness issue.  This bug is very obvious.  Deleted instances should not be processed on.  Calls to compute_api.get_all() need to set the 'deleted' filter if you don't want deleted instances to show up...

Dan: Nice catch!"}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-10-12 16:28:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Hm.  I missed Todd's first comment.  After thinking about it more, I tend to agree with Todd...  we should probably have a default of 'deleted: False' inside of compute_api.get_all() which can be overriden by passing search_opts setting it to 'True' when 'changes-since' is used in OS API."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2011-10-12 16:35:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2011-10-12 16:38:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Todd: I updated the docstring for the compute API so that it explicitly mentions that deleted instances get returned by default.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-10-12 16:39:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Good enough for me.  Guess we'll need to file bugs for the other calls that use get_all()."}, {'account_id': 34, 'date': '2011-10-12 16:43:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

LGTM.

I'll file bugs for what I suspect are errors in how VSA uses compute.API.get_all.

I'll also update my metadata patch to set deleted=False."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2011-10-12 16:58:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, approved

Looks good and fixes unit tests.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-10-12 17:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-09-25 06:55:04.000000000', 'message': "Allow tenant networks to be shared with domain 0.

If domain 0 has an IP address on a given bridge, then add a flow rule to
allow traffic to leave that port.  This allows for the case where domain 0
and the tenant network are sharing a bridge, which is useful in non-production
environments.

At the same time, simplify the interface to ovs_configure_base_rules.py.
There is no need to pass the bridge in, because it's implicit in the selection
of the physical interface, and can be obtained using ovs-vsctl iface-to-br.

Having made these two changes, it's now reasonable to apply flow rules to all
interfaces as a default (if not overridden in the sysconfig file).

Change-Id: I2a33ed55246d49b0e4f57db909e1b40351d27602
"}]
commit_message:
Allow tenant networks to be shared with domain 0.

If domain 0 has an IP address on a given bridge, then add a flow rule to
allow traffic to leave that port.  This allows for the case where domain 0
and the tenant network are sharing a bridge, which is useful in non-production
environments.

At the same time, simplify the interface to ovs_configure_base_rules.py.
There is no need to pass the bridge in, because it's implicit in the selection
of the physical interface, and can be obtained using ovs-vsctl iface-to-br.

Having made these two changes, it's now reasonable to apply flow rules to all
interfaces as a default (if not overridden in the sysconfig file).

Change-Id: I2a33ed55246d49b0e4f57db909e1b40351d27602

commit_message:
Use ovs-vsctl iface-to-br to look up the bridge associated with the given VIF.
This avoids assuming that vifX.Y is attached to xenbrY, which is untrue in
the general case.

Change-Id: Ie3398b4a2231e0483acae272be71cb09a1744872

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-09-29 15:25:03.000000000', 'message': "install_venv: don't use --no-site-packages with virtualenv

libvirt isn't listed in pip-requires because (a) it's not in PyPi and
(b) you always want to use libvirt's python bindings that matches the
version of libvirt installed on the system.

Currently, running nova-compute in virtualenv fails because libvirt
can't be imported. The --no-site-packages flag is what prevents this.
Everything seems to work fine without it. To verify, try deleting the
no-global-site-packages.txt from your .nova-venv.

Change-Id: I1df5e8e3c4426ca333c2d6b5b4fa8ece144dddf3
"}]
commit_message:
install_venv: don't use --no-site-packages with virtualenv

libvirt isn't listed in pip-requires because (a) it's not in PyPi and
(b) you always want to use libvirt's python bindings that matches the
version of libvirt installed on the system.

Currently, running nova-compute in virtualenv fails because libvirt
can't be imported. The --no-site-packages flag is what prevents this.
Everything seems to work fine without it. To verify, try deleting the
no-global-site-packages.txt from your .nova-venv.

Change-Id: I1df5e8e3c4426ca333c2d6b5b4fa8ece144dddf3

commit_message:
install_venv: pass the --upgrade argument to pip install

Subsequent runs of install_venv.sh should upgrade packages to the
latest available.

commit_message:
Returning flavor ids as uuids in OSAPI v1.1

Begins to address bug 872645. This just changes how instance_type.flavorid is presented through v1.1 of the OpenStack
API.

Change-Id: Ifa0998622b3a5425ca116e19899a1ac471550efa

commit_message:
Updating image progress to be more granular.
Before, the image progress had only 2 states, 0 and 100. Now it can be
0, 25, 50 or 100.

Change-Id: Ic5de9d4404c8903bc2a6027697905f92374f8af7

commit_message:
Remove AoE, Clean up volume code

 * Removes Ata Over Ethernet
 * Adds drivers to libvirt for volumes
 * Adds initialize_connection and terminate_connection to volume api
 * Passes connection info back through volume api

Change-Id: I1b1626f40bebe8466ab410fb174683293c7c474f

commit_message:
Handle pidfile exception for dnsmasq

Capture the exception in dnsmasq_pid_for method. If the pidfile cannot be read
for some reason, it should be treated as if it does not exist. This prevents
issues where the filesystem write delay leaves the file created but empty.
Fixes bug 865399.

Change-Id: I3b0f1211762696f925ae32d785ffa6a35c5e1d6b

commit_message:
Refactoring/cleanup around our exception handling

Fixes LP Bug #820643 - import_class() does not
report original exception.

* Makes ALL exceptions now use base exception class
* Removes unused exception classes from Nova
* Removes unused code in glance.common.utils
* Adds unit tests for bool_from_string and import_class

Change-Id: If6775eb3ce85390bc5d579dff6c59c6066e77e9b

commit_message:
Add support for header version parameter to specify API version.

bug 844905

The 1.1 API specifies that the API version can be determined by URL path
(eg /v1.1/tenant/servers/detail), Content-Type header
(eg application/json;version=1.1) or Accept header
(eg application/json;q=0.8;version=1.1, application/xml;q=0.2;version=1.1).

Change-Id: I01220cf1eebc0f759d66563ec67ef2f697c6d310

messages:
[{'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-07 16:21:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Julien, typically a commit like this (feedback to an existing review) should be squashed back into the branch it was based on. See this wiki if you need more information: http://wiki.openstack.org/GerritWorkflow. Once you squash this commit into the other, this review can be abandoned.'}, {'account_id': 191, 'date': '2011-10-07 20:23:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not submit

ditto'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2011-10-10 07:56:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hum this likely sounds like a bad idea, for obvious reasons like atomic commit and revertability, but your call.
I've resubmited it."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-10-10 15:28:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Feel free to officially abandon this change. It doesn't need to be active in Gerrit anymore."}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2011-10-10 15:35:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Not needed anymore.'}]

[{'created': '2011-10-06 15:18:47.000000000', 'message': 'Include original exception in ClassNotFound exception

By doing this, we allow the error messages to be more useful. When an import
of a class fails because of a missing module dependency, it would have fail
that way for example:

$ nova-manage
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./bin/nova-manage", line 84, in <module>
    from nova import image
  File "/home/jd/Work/src/nova/nova/image/__init__.py", line 22, in <module>
    from nova.image import glance
  File "/home/jd/Work/src/nova/nova/image/glance.py", line 42, in <module>
    GlanceClient = utils.import_class('glance.client.Client')
  File "/home/jd/Work/src/nova/nova/utils.py", line 66, in import_class
    raise exception.ClassNotFound(class_name=class_str)
nova.exception.ClassNotFound: Class Client could not be found

This does not help the user, since it indicates the class Client cannot be
found, even if it is actually found but fail to import.

With this commit, the error message is better:
nova-manage
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./bin/nova-manage", line 84, in <module>
    from nova import image
  File "/home/jd/Work/src/nova/nova/image/__init__.py", line 22, in <module>
    from nova.image import glance
  File "/home/jd/Work/src/nova/nova/image/glance.py", line 42, in <module>
    GlanceClient = utils.import_class('glance.client.Client')
  File "/home/jd/Work/src/nova/nova/utils.py", line 66, in import_class
    raise exception.ClassNotFound(class_name=class_str, exception=exc)
nova.exception.ClassNotFound: Class Client could not be found: No module named kombu.connection

This helps to know that in this kombu is missing.

It would probably even better to rename ClassNotFound to
ClassCannotBeImported or something like that too.

Change-Id: I4100d931a0a825fa0729d5467d2f9268fdd2a261
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
Include original exception in ClassNotFound exception

By doing this, we allow the error messages to be more useful. When an import
of a class fails because of a missing module dependency, it would have fail
that way for example:

$ nova-manage
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./bin/nova-manage", line 84, in <module>
    from nova import image
  File "/home/jd/Work/src/nova/nova/image/__init__.py", line 22, in <module>
    from nova.image import glance
  File "/home/jd/Work/src/nova/nova/image/glance.py", line 42, in <module>
    GlanceClient = utils.import_class('glance.client.Client')
  File "/home/jd/Work/src/nova/nova/utils.py", line 66, in import_class
    raise exception.ClassNotFound(class_name=class_str)
nova.exception.ClassNotFound: Class Client could not be found

This does not help the user, since it indicates the class Client cannot be
found, even if it is actually found but fail to import.

With this commit, the error message is better:
nova-manage
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./bin/nova-manage", line 84, in <module>
    from nova import image
  File "/home/jd/Work/src/nova/nova/image/__init__.py", line 22, in <module>
    from nova.image import glance
  File "/home/jd/Work/src/nova/nova/image/glance.py", line 42, in <module>
    GlanceClient = utils.import_class('glance.client.Client')
  File "/home/jd/Work/src/nova/nova/utils.py", line 66, in import_class
    raise exception.ClassNotFound(class_name=class_str, exception=exc)
nova.exception.ClassNotFound: Class Client could not be found: No module named kombu.connection

This helps to know that in this kombu is missing.

It would probably even better to rename ClassNotFound to
ClassCannotBeImported or something like that too.

Change-Id: I4100d931a0a825fa0729d5467d2f9268fdd2a261
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien.danjou@enovance.com>

subject: Extend test_virt_driver to also test libvirt driver.
messages: [{'account_id': 518, 'date': '2011-10-10 11:04:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 518, 'date': '2011-10-10 13:27:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned\n\nErk, trunk diverged too far. I need more time to fix this up.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2011-09-26 14:16:54.000000000', 'message': "Extend test_virt_driver to also test libvirt driver.

To support this, I've added a fake libvirt implementation. It's supposed
to expose an API and behaviour identical to that of libvirt itself
except without actually running any VM's or setting up any firewall or
anything, but still responding correctly when asked for a domain's XML,
a list of defined domains, running domains, etc.

I've also split out everything from libvirt.connection that is
potentially destructive or otherwise undesirable to run during testing,
and moved it to a new nova.virt.libvirt.utils. I added tests for those
things separately as well as stub version of it for testing. I hope
eventually to make it similar to fakelibvirt in style (e.g. keep track
of files created and deleted and attempts to open a file that it doesn't
know about, you'll get proper exceptions with proper errnos set and
whatnot).

Change-Id: I659ca4e1c46ee5826353c51641b9c329c36bcd7b

Change-Id: I659ca4e1c46ee5826353c51641b9c329c36bcd7b
"}]
commit_message:
Extend test_virt_driver to also test libvirt driver.

To support this, I've added a fake libvirt implementation. It's supposed
to expose an API and behaviour identical to that of libvirt itself
except without actually running any VM's or setting up any firewall or
anything, but still responding correctly when asked for a domain's XML,
a list of defined domains, running domains, etc.

I've also split out everything from libvirt.connection that is
potentially destructive or otherwise undesirable to run during testing,
and moved it to a new nova.virt.libvirt.utils. I added tests for those
things separately as well as stub version of it for testing. I hope
eventually to make it similar to fakelibvirt in style (e.g. keep track
of files created and deleted and attempts to open a file that it doesn't
know about, you'll get proper exceptions with proper errnos set and
whatnot).

Change-Id: I659ca4e1c46ee5826353c51641b9c329c36bcd7b

subject: use git config's review.username for rfc.sh
messages:
[{'account_id': 100, 'date': '2011-09-26 23:59:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Every new branch I create has rfc.sh complaining so I was happy see this branch.

But it doesn't look like this would work for me. I have user.name set to my name "Johannes Erdfelt", which isn't the same as my username "johannes.erdfelt".

It seems like user.name is standardized for the users name, not necessarily username.

Or am I missing something?'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-09-27 05:28:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Same comment as Johannes.  It's hard to have this try to do the right thing, but it'd be nice if it could."}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2011-09-27 22:59:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

a quick scan through the git logs seems to indicate that i am one the few people who use name in this way, what we can perhaps do instead then is just add a new config variable, something like git config --global review.username termie

What do we think of that idea? I think using environment variables is pretty terrible and using git configs gives us much more flexibility'}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2011-09-27 23:14:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2011-09-27 23:35:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-09-28 01:03:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I agree it's more flexible.  However, it's rather funny storing your launchpad username in git config.  :)   After looking this script over, there are a number of things that are hurting my eyes.  I won't make you fix them, but maybe you could at least add another check for empty USERNAME after the git config call you added... and barf if it's still empty with a little note to the user?"}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2011-09-28 03:24:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

review.username is a good choice'}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2011-09-30 17:28:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Chris: it already barfs and asks the user to enter one, that is the script's default behavior. As for storing a website's username I think it is significantly less weird than storing that username in an environment variable"}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-09-30 17:34:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Yeah.  It's just that the reason it barfs is dumb:

 add_remote $USERNAME $origin_project

That'll fail because that equates to: "add_remote $origin_project" so add_remote tries to use the project for username... with a blank project.  This of course fails, so it does ask for a username.   But really, at least a "" should go around $USERNAME...  

I'll ignore it for now.  This is fine.  The script needs a lot more work to make me be happy with it overall.'}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2011-09-30 18:00:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Chris: I have similar issues, I'll probably send in more updates to start fixing other things"}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2011-10-05 18:24:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

at what point does something attempt to merge this?'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2011-10-05 18:43:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

When you get two nova-core approvals. You only have one right now (Chris).'}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-10-08 19:14:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-10-08 19:14:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Build Started https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova-merge/74/ (1/3)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-10-08 19:15:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Build Started https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova-pep8/1446/ (2/3)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-10-08 19:21:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Build Started https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova/121595/ (3/3)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-10-08 19:30:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova-merge/74/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova-pep8/1446/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova/121595/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-10-08 19:30:55.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
Make sure unknown extensions return 404

At the moment, if an extension doens't exist and we call a show method
with wrong id then the exception is not captured. There is a need to
return NOTFOUND exception.
Fixes bug 869153.

Change-Id: Ie0b2c2e87c5a61f6db74bb10a4740add2ab8ea27

Fixes LP Bug#860862 - Security creds still shown

This removes the X-Image-Meta-Location entirely from
GET /images/<ID> and HEAD /images/<ID>

Previous fix only removed from GET /images and GET /images/detail.

Doh.

Change-Id: Ib6c124e196688a77a3a0090bf9174a1daffb78bb

commit_message:
Allow db schema downgrades

When a destination version is specified, check the current version and allow
downgrading the schema. Fixes bug 865357.

Change-Id: I47104158884421de92f50322a72243c170a4f1ad

subject: Add more specific error messages to swift-ring-builder
messages:
[{'account_id': 330, 'date': '2011-09-22 18:44:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The code (just looking at the diff) looks good to me, but I'd prefer that gholt review this since he knows most about the ring builder."}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2011-09-27 06:58:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

$ pep8 bin/swift-ring-builder 
bin/swift-ring-builder:507:80: E501 line too long (80 characters)

This is probably just a personal preference but for really long strings instead
of cases like:

                print ("An error occurred while removing device with id %d\n"
                       "This usually means that you attempted to remove the\n"
                       "last device in a ring. If this is the case, consider\n"
                       "creating a new ring instead.\n"
                       "The on-disk ring builder is unchanged\n"
                       "Original exception message: %s" % (dev['id'], e.message)
                       )

Would it not be a bit cleaner to have things like:

                print '''
An error occurred while removing device with id %d.
This usually means that you attempted to remove the last device in a ring.
If this is the case, consider creating a new ring instead.
The on-disk ring builder is unchanged.
Original exception message: %s
                '''.strip() % (dev['id'], e.message)

I'm good with this change no matter if the above thoughts are taken into
consideration. Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 449, 'date': '2011-09-27 17:21:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 449, 'date': '2011-09-27 17:22:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Add more specific error messages to swift-ring-builder

Replace existing Exceptions in ring builder with more specific exceptions.
Abstracted out some behavior in ring-builder that is likely to cause an
exception. Add try/except blocks to swift-ring-builder to catch specific
exceptions and provide the user with some information about how to deal
with the error.

This change begins to address blueprint friendly-error-messages

Change-Id: I8fc9cfa4899421fe04bba23ac52523778e902321

commit_message:
Fix for bug 845952

Devices scheduled to be removed are assigned a device of 65535.  When
looking for parts to reassign from heavy nodes, these parts need to be
skipped.

Includes review suggestions

Change-Id: I61f40c36509bf998834c123b0f80117ca6def3ff

subject: Allow serialization to be performed lazily
messages:
[{'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-09-27 21:10:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

First of all, I wouldn't call the existing system 'stupid'. That is insulting to many people who worked extremely hard to get wsgi serialization to where it is today. I would, however, agree that the extensions mechanism is not as functional as it could be and I would love to make it better. 

So...I don't really grasp what this branch is trying to do. Is there a blueprint you can share with us?"}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-09-27 21:53:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

My comment about "stupid" applies specifically to the fact that extensions have to deserialize the data, mutate it, and reserialize it.  I have problems with the way serialization is done as well, but I wouldn't describe _that_ as stupid, and I will freely admit that I haven't yet discussed the subject with the original developers to understand their rationale for doing things the way they didmy feelings on that may well change once I have those discussions.

As for what this patch doesthe idea is to allow serialization to be done later in the chain.  Right now, "later in the chain" means in the middleware directly below the application, but the second step is to refactor extensions so they no longer have to do the serialization round trip; at that point, I'll swap the order of the extensions middleware with my serialization middleware.  (I didn't want to do that in this change, because I expect it to touch a lot of code, and I wanted to get comments on this code specifically.  I like relatively narrow change domains, when I can pull them off...)'}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2011-09-27 22:20:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Waldon: Put more simply, the problem is the extension spec allows one to extend an existing resource, and having to deserialize the response blob at every step in the chain is both a performance nightmare and an all around pain in the ass. Made doubly painful by the fact that the XML side of things transforms certain field names, rearranges other bits, and whitelists specific fields so adding new ones is troublesome.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-09-28 20:46:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-10-04 16:58:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I am working on an alternate approach that attaches the serializer and other data to the request, but json-ifies the response object (instead of pickling).  I'm not ready to abandon this merge quite yet, though."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2011-10-07 15:31:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

Superseded by change 818, implementing xml-templates blueprint'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2011-09-27 21:04:00.000000000', 'message': "Allow serialization to be performed lazily

Currently, extensions have to deserialize data, mutate it, then
reserialize the data.  This is stupid.  This patch takes the
first step for fixing this, by performing serialization lazily:
it adds a new 'serializer' middleware which performs the actual
serialization.

Currently, extensions still receive the serialized data, and
are expected to return serialized data; the next merge-prop
will take care of adapting them to expect and utilize
LazyResponse objects.

Change-Id: I88ae769759429c912089408b63eeaea3e4af26e3
"}, {'created': '2011-09-28 20:46:56.000000000', 'message': "Allow serialization to be performed lazily

Currently, request extensions have to deserialize data, mutate it, then
reserialize the data.  This patch fixes this problem by performing
serialization lazily: it adds a new 'serializer' middleware which
performs the actual serialization.

Request extensions formerly registered a handler taking two arguments:
the request and the response.  They now get a third argument: an
instance of LazyResponse.  This third argument is extracted from the
response body, so handlers should no longer attempt to manipulate the
response body directly; instead, they should modify the LazyResponse
object (particularly the 'data' attribute) as needed.  The LazyResponse
object will be reattached to the response, replacing the response body,
after all extension handlers have been called.

Change-Id: I88ae769759429c912089408b63eeaea3e4af26e3
"}]
commit_message:
Allow serialization to be performed lazily

Currently, request extensions have to deserialize data, mutate it, then
reserialize the data.  This patch fixes this problem by performing
serialization lazily: it adds a new 'serializer' middleware which
performs the actual serialization.

Request extensions formerly registered a handler taking two arguments:
the request and the response.  They now get a third argument: an
instance of LazyResponse.  This third argument is extracted from the
response body, so handlers should no longer attempt to manipulate the
response body directly; instead, they should modify the LazyResponse
object (particularly the 'data' attribute) as needed.  The LazyResponse
object will be reattached to the response, replacing the response body,
after all extension handlers have been called.

Change-Id: I88ae769759429c912089408b63eeaea3e4af26e3

commit_message:
Stop returning correct password on api calls

Captured invalid signature exception in authentication step, so that
the problem is not returning exception to user, revealing the real
password.
Fixes bug 868360.

Change-Id: Idb31f076a7b14309f0fda698261de816924da354

Set error state on spawn error + integration test.

This branch should at least be considered a partial fix for bug 698336.

(Update) Grammar fix.
(Update) PEP8 fix.
(Update) Merged with origin/master
(Update) Fixed test (oops!) thanks comstud!

commit_message:
Refactoring registry api controllers

Break up images and members controllers in the registry api and restructure it to be more like the glance api. This is
in preparation for the future split.

Change-Id: I81e6c74815cf15adebb526b31614fd2e63982c3d
