subject: Add RBD store backend.
messages:
[{'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-09-27 18:11:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(3 inline comments)

Some tiny fixups in the inline comments, but overall this is awesome work! Really looking forward to this as an alternative high-availability storage driver to Swift.

Also, please do the following:

* Update the docs in /docs/source/configuring.rst and /docs/source/architecture.rst

* Add RDB settings to the example config files in etc/glance-api.conf

* Add rados and rds to the tools/pip-requires file for development purposes...

Cheers!
-jay"}, {'account_id': 1107, 'date': '2011-09-28 18:21:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1107, 'date': '2011-09-28 18:31:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I updated the docs and added config options for RADOS user and ceph config file. Since the new options might be needed for the test, I also made it read a config file like the s3 and swift tests.

I think I've addressed all your comments - the addition to pip-requires I'm unsure about, since the libraries won't be installable from pypi, but if you don't mind developers removing those lines when they aren't using rbd that's fine with me."}, {'account_id': 1107, 'date': '2011-09-28 19:29:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Ah, I forgot the review alias auto-rebases. It looks like I need to fix two tests now."}, {'account_id': 1107, 'date': '2011-09-28 21:38:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1107, 'date': '2011-09-28 21:39:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

The tests work again. I also moved non-repeated initialization from setUp to __init__.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-09-29 16:19:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

The code looks pretty good, but I don't see 'rados' or 'rbd' available through pypi."}, {'account_id': 1107, 'date': '2011-09-29 17:28:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> The code looks pretty good, but I don't see 'rados' or 'rbd' available through pypi.
The rados and rbd python modules are just thin wrappers around C libraries whose APIs aren't stable, so we keep them in the same tree as the libraries, where they aren't full python packages. 

I was hoping pip would be able to find the installed version (the python-ceph package and 'make install' put the python bindings in the right place), but it looks like that doesn't work. I'm fine with leaving rbd and rados out of pip-requires for now, and documenting that they need the python-ceph package on debian and derivatives."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-09-29 19:08:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Ya, I didn't realize the rds and rados packages weren't installable via PyPI. Go ahead and take them out of pip-requires and add a little note about python-ceph in the configuration documentation.."}, {'account_id': 1107, 'date': '2011-09-29 19:15:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-09-29 19:23:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

OK, just one more thing, Josh, I promise! :) Sorry I forgot to mention this earlier, but could you put together a unit test for the new backend? You can take a look at the glance/tests/unit/test_swift_store.py for an example of stubbing out the communication with the RDS driver.

Thank you!
-jay"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-09-29 19:25:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Won't adding a unit test require that we manually install the rds/rados python packages? I absolutely don't want to add any unittests that don't allow us to use the venv. What do you think?"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-09-29 19:28:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Brian, yes, that is true. I didn't think of that. OK, let's leave them out for now until the RDS/Rados Python packaging is a bit better..."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-09-29 20:37:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(1 inline comment)

Seeing some issues running the functional tests. It doesn't skip the tests if the env variable isn't defined. The tests just fail trying to read self.rbd_store_ceph_conf."}, {'account_id': 1107, 'date': '2011-09-29 21:14:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1107, 'date': '2011-09-29 21:29:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Updated to skip test setup when the env var isn't set, rebased, and retested everything. If it's not working for you, I can help with any Ceph issue on IRC."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-09-30 13:51:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Ok, so the skips work now. I'm still getting a problem when I try to run the tests now. I installed python-ceph from apt and set up the following config file:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/2622/

I tried to run the tests and here's the output. Looks like the test is coded to expect a different Rados.__init__:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/2621/"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-09-30 13:53:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Josh, if you can find me on IRC today this might go faster. My nick is 'bcwaldon'"}, {'account_id': 1107, 'date': '2011-09-30 15:37:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Sorry, I thought I'd responded to your inline comment, but I guess it was just saved as a draft.

You'll need to update to a more recent version -- if you want packages, see http://ceph.newdream.net/docs/latest/ops/autobuilt/ and use the master branch. I'll look for you on IRC later."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-09-30 17:34:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, approved

commit_message:
Add RBD store backend.

To use this you'll need the latest version of Ceph from git,
which will become version 0.37.

Change-Id: Ia2126395525759eb8c11df055bdc6f286dea97b9

Adds a script that can automatically delete orphaned VDIs. Also had to move some flags around to avoid circular imports.

Fixes bug 809614.

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-09-23 22:43:01.000000000', 'message': "flags.py: Use '--optional_flagfile' to specify a flagfile that may not exist

Pre-parse flagfiles from FlagValues.__call_ prior to the base class, so we can check
existence of any optional_flagfiles.   If the file exists, append it to argv as a
regular '--flagfile' before gflags.FlagVlues  does its parsing/loading.  The
original '--optional_flagfile' is then later ignored as an unknown argument
its not declared anywhere.

Fixes LP bug 839796.

Change-Id: I24afb1e934d07dc47876c64ce863014c8ee848fe
"}]
commit_message:
flags.py: Use '--optional_flagfile' to specify a flagfile that may not exist

Pre-parse flagfiles from FlagValues.__call_ prior to the base class, so we can check
existence of any optional_flagfiles.   If the file exists, append it to argv as a
regular '--flagfile' before gflags.FlagVlues  does its parsing/loading.  The
original '--optional_flagfile' is then later ignored as an unknown argument
its not declared anywhere.

Fixes LP bug 839796.

Change-Id: I24afb1e934d07dc47876c64ce863014c8ee848fe

subject: Deallocate ip if build fails.
messages:
[{'account_id': 209, 'date': '2011-09-27 22:00:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 191, 'date': '2011-09-28 17:58:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, approved

looks good to me. Should solve the problem just fine. Also, just to note, deallocate_for_instance() does more than just update whhichever fixed ip(s) that the instance had allocated. It also takes care of disassociating floating ips and deleting vifs as well.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-09-28 17:58:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build Started https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova-pep8/1417/ (1/3)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-09-28 17:58:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build Started https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova-merge/45/ (2/3)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-09-28 17:58:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build Started https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova/121562/ (3/3)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-09-28 18:08:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Build Unstable 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova-pep8/1417/ : UNSTABLE 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova-merge/45/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova/121562/ : SUCCESS"}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-09-30 06:00:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I found a workaround, because we use a 3 arg raise in nova/exception.py and that one is fine.  It appears if you change:

raise type_, value, traceback

to this:

exc_info = (type_, value, traceback)
raise exc_info[0], exc_info[1], exc_info[2]

pep8 will pass with the above.  I'm guessing the brackets make it pass.  This is definitely a pep8 bug."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-09-30 06:11:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Now that I actually looked at your diff, you can simply:  exc_info = sys.exc_info() in place of breaking it out..

And when you re-raise, use exc_info[0], ....

That'll be pretty clean.... and pass pep8."}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2011-09-30 15:34:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-09-30 16:08:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

lgtm.'}, {'account_id': 209, 'date': '2011-09-30 16:55:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, approved

subject: List both owned and public images
messages:
[{'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-09-30 15:48:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Hi! Please mark this changeset Abandoned (click the Abandon button near the Review button).

You need to squash this commit into its dependent commit and then do a git review...

In the future, when making little fixups like this to a previously-submitted patch, simply do:

git commit -a --amend

Cheers!
-jay"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-09-30 15:50:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

In case you are not familiar with squashing, what I meant was that you need to do a:

git rebase -i

In your local topic branch, and then mark the commit at the top of your page with "squash", then save.'}, {'account_id': 1631, 'date': '2011-09-30 16:52:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

As requested, change integrated with review request 761'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2011-09-30 14:18:44.000000000', 'message': 'List both owned and public images

Enable listing of all images, both private which are owned and the public
ones. Only list the private/snapshots for the owner and admin users.
Fixed bug 863305 (snapshot listing part)

Change-Id: I7785daa15a795abd168234d59460ab2c729b5e50
'}]
commit_message:
List both owned and public images

Enable listing of all images, both private which are owned and the public
ones. Only list the private/snapshots for the owner and admin users.
Fixed bug 863305 (snapshot listing part)

Change-Id: I7785daa15a795abd168234d59460ab2c729b5e50

messages:
[{'account_id': 4, 'date': '2011-09-30 15:33:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, approved

Awesome, thank you!'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-09-30 15:33:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build Started https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/keystone/348/ (2/4)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-09-30 15:33:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build Started https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/keystone-pylint/356/ (1/4)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-09-30 15:34:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build Started https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/keystone-pep8/283/ (3/4)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-09-30 15:34:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build Started https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/keystone-merge/240/ (4/4)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-09-30 15:34:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Fails

Build Failed 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/keystone-pylint/356/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/keystone/348/ : FAILURE 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/keystone-pep8/283/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/keystone-merge/240/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2011-09-30 15:48:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2011-09-30 15:51:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Bah, sorry - didn't re-run the full test suite after a last minute change

Basically, the old code did:

  if not "username" in creds:
     raise BadRequest(...)

and the new code does:

  if not creds.get("username"):
     raise BadRequest(...)

so, before passing {"username":None} would have given a 401, it now gives a 400

I think a 400 still makes sense, so I've updated the failing tests'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2011-09-30 15:53:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, approved

commit_message:
Refactor and unit test json auth parsing

There's a bunch of code copied-and-pasted between the json parsers
in the two auth types. Refactor the code out into a base class.

First, though, unit test the code to ensure no regressions.

v2: update test_user_auth_with_no_{name,password} to expect a
    400 return instead of 401.

Change-Id: I50802419ec82d98f4cb56e93c163158d3326c5c9

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-09-30 15:00:02.000000000', 'message': 'Do not return identical error messages twice

e.g.

 $> curl -d '{"passwordCredentials": ...}' -H "Content-type: application/json" http://localhost:5000/v2.0/tokens

should return:

 {"badRequest": {"message": "Expecting auth", "code": "400"}}

not:

 {"badRequest": {"message": "Expecting auth or Expecting auth", "code": "400"}}

Change-Id: I76a432cbb4c964f4050b8596c773e0a553120ca3
'}]
commit_message:
Do not return identical error messages twice

e.g.

 $> curl -d '{"passwordCredentials": ...}' -H "Content-type: application/json" http://localhost:5000/v2.0/tokens

should return:

 {"badRequest": {"message": "Expecting auth", "code": "400"}}

not:

 {"badRequest": {"message": "Expecting auth or Expecting auth", "code": "400"}}

Change-Id: I76a432cbb4c964f4050b8596c773e0a553120ca3

subject: Changes to stored hashed password in backends. Using passlib a password hashing library. Using sha512. Setting hashing to be the default behavior.
messages:
[{'account_id': 8, 'date': '2011-09-28 20:47:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2011-09-28 21:57:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2011-09-28 22:00:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Opened https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/861872'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2011-09-28 22:03:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I'd highly recommend using bcrypt instead of salted SHA1. It's  designed to make brute forcing much harder.

Also, random salts are ideal. There's no need to have a static salt configured. bcrypt makes it easy to create a random salt."}, {'account_id': 8, 'date': '2011-09-28 22:07:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Are you justing a Random salt for every value?
Should I combine Random salt and store it with the hashed value in the DB? For me that sounded insecure.'}, {'account_id': 8, 'date': '2011-09-28 22:08:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Also is there an openstack standard way of hashing?'}, {'account_id': 8, 'date': '2011-09-28 22:10:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Eventually we might provide options on which algo on which hashing need to happen.Thats a future task.'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2011-09-28 22:14:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Yes, a random salt for every password. The salt isn't a key. It's safe to store it with the password. Most password hashing algorithms store the salt right in the password hash. Look at crypt().

Here's some more information on why you should use bcrypt:

http://codahale.com/how-to-safely-store-a-password/"}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-09-28 22:18:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

@Johannes - I absolutely agree that bcrypt would provide better security, but for the first round of password hashing (meaning currently right now everything is plain text) I'd say this is a huge improvement.

hashlib does support sha512, so you could change the sha1 call to sha512 to gain a good deal more brute force prevention.

Also, +1 on the storing a random salt with the password. Good catch Johannes."}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2011-09-28 22:38:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

If you really want to use SHA512, there's a well defined format for hashes that stores the salt along with it. It might be wise to follow this instead of creating something custom.

http://www.akkadia.org/drepper/SHA-crypt.txt"}, {'account_id': 8, 'date': '2011-09-29 02:51:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 8, 'date': '2011-09-29 03:05:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 8, 'date': '2011-09-29 03:08:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

i have used pass lib and sha512.
http://packages.python.org/passlib/lib/passlib.hash.sha512_crypt.html

Have not changed any of the defaults.A salt gets generated automatically.
Could go to the extent of parameterizing every possible hash parameter.Again this is first cut.Way better than plain passwords.
Suggestions are welcome.'}, {'account_id': 1228, 'date': '2011-09-29 15:33:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-09-29 15:59:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Good start to hashing, thanks!'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2011-09-29 16:42:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-09-29 16:42:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Build Started https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/keystone/340/ (2/4)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-09-29 16:42:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Build Started https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/keystone-pylint/348/ (1/4)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-09-29 16:42:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Build Started https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/keystone-pep8/275/ (3/4)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-09-29 16:42:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Build Started https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/keystone-merge/232/ (4/4)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-09-29 16:42:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Fails

subject: Fixes euca-describe-instances failing or not showing IPs
messages:
[{'account_id': 385, 'date': '2011-09-25 17:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(3 inline comments)

The instance.get('virtual_interfaces', []) calls should use the network API and not fall back on an empty list unless it is never needed (since it will always be empty).

The joinloading of VIFs to the fixed and floating are also not possible since Quantum and Melange might not share a database.

In my merge prop I have extended the network api to allow lookups of floating ips by fixed ip."}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2011-09-25 17:09:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Ignore my first comment about instance.get. I saw that its getting stuffed in now from the network api.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-09-25 19:04:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yeah, I'm going to have to completely re-work this now, since you submitted a partial fix for this.  There were 2 bug ids for essentially the same problem."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-09-28 23:01:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-09-28 23:03:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Not quite ready.  Missed some other DB calls for IPs."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-09-28 23:05:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

Nevermind.  This should probably go in as-is... as it addresses the bug.  There are other calls to IPs in ec2/cloud.py that will need to be switched out at some point, but they currently work.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-09-29 04:40:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

And I just found a bug in master that this branch happens to fix by accident.  Top level zones that get a list of servers from a child zone try to re-format IP addresses and end up getting a KeyError when grabbing IPs for an instance.  This branch happens to fix this issue, because I moved where IPs are grabbed.'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2011-09-29 15:59:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Is bueno!

Only comment I have is that placing the network call in the view builder breaks the presentation layer pattern thingie. But I think in this case it make the code cleaner and not as janky.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2011-09-29 16:11:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Yeah, I hear you on the moving some stuff into the "presentation" layer.  Unfortunately, it seems like it's the best place for it...  because otherwise we could be querying the network manager for information that is never used.  Only the presentation layer knows whether or not it's needed.'}, {'account_id': 191, 'date': '2011-09-29 17:27:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2011-09-29 17:36:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, approved

I guess this is fine'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-09-29 17:36:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-09-25 05:27:29.000000000', 'message': "Makes compute_api.get() and get_all() return instances with
'virtual_interfaces' set and removes accessing of instance['fixed_ips']

Fixes bug 855660

A previous merge removed the joining of 'virtual_interfaces' and
'fixed_ips' when doing a compute_api.get_all().  This patch makes sure
to have compute api's get() and get_all() methods return
instance['virtual_interfaces'] appropriately.  It also changes all code
that uses instance['fixed_ips'] to use the 'virtual_interfaces' list.

The idea with the previous merge is that we'll force queries for network
information to be separate from querying the instances from the DB.
This allows pulling instance network information from an external
service.  Unfortunately the previous merge was a bit broken.

I've also removed the joinload_all of 'fixed_ips.floating_ips' with a
db.instance_get() and db.instance_get_all() to match
db.instance_get_by_filters().  The joins are no longer necessary due to
the above fixes.

This also fixes an issue with OS api servers_actions tests where
tearDown wasn't calling super().

Added compute tests to make sure 'virtual_interfaces' is set appropriate.

Change-Id: I455637a9feb802291dfaf2ef694dabc2607784f9
"}, {'created': '2011-09-28 23:01:45.000000000', 'message': "Fixes euca-describe-instances failing or not showing IPs

Fixes bug 855660

Makes EC2 call network manager to get IP information now, to match the
same change to OS API
Also refactors a bit of OS API's calls... moving some code into 'common'

Fixed tests.  Some tests for OS API v1.0 were not properly testing.

Fixed imports per HACKING in files touched.

Change-Id: I455637a9feb802291dfaf2ef694dabc2607784f9
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes euca-describe-instances failing or not showing IPs

Fixes bug 855660

Makes EC2 call network manager to get IP information now, to match the
same change to OS API
Also refactors a bit of OS API's calls... moving some code into 'common'

Fixed tests.  Some tests for OS API v1.0 were not properly testing.

Fixed imports per HACKING in files touched.

Change-Id: I455637a9feb802291dfaf2ef694dabc2607784f9

commit_message:
Change 'recurse_zones' to 'local_zone_only'.

Fixes bug 861753

Zone recursion should be the default and now 'recurse_zones' as an
optional search argument no longer makes sense.  'local_zone_only=True' can
now be specified to override the new default of recursing zones.

Change-Id: I5c3c849e9077117b2023f637b82831fa14b656b1

commit_message:
bug lp845714

Kind of fixes it, this calls resize on the instance. The space will be
available, but the partition won't be resized to use this space.
Running fdisk -l will show the additional space(after a discussion here
I was told this solution was best for the moment).

Adding myself to Authors

Change-Id: Ice9b12b64b266bd291e7c689114b1172e317e144

commit_message:
Enforce snapshot cleanup.

Makes sure that the snapshot and the temporary directory is cleaned up,
even if qemu-img fails. Fixes bug 861582.

Change-Id: I3c7798215c8d0d5dc979379a13e038098b0f31d4

commit_message:
Merge from launchpad quantum/diablo branch:

  merge salv's fix to remove keystone middleware: lp855151
  one more 202->200 from tyler
  merge tylers additional 202 -> 200 changes
  merge additions to OVS readme describing running with multiple hosts
  merge brad's changes to make create API calls return 200, not 202
  merge unit test for showing unset attachment
  merging API docs branch
  Merge: lp:~yinliu2/quantum/bug856564
  Merge: lp:~bgh/quantum/bug850261

Change-Id: I56fe24c59f918737e57b562343c33ec6dcceac60

commit_message:
Snapshots/backups can no longer happen simultaneously. Tests included.

Implemented exception.InstanceBusy when attempting to snapshot/backup an
instance which is already snapshotting or being currently backed up.

Fixes bug 727502.

(Patch Set 2) 3 new exceptions: InstanceBusy, InstanceSnapshotting, and InstanceBackingUp
(Patch Set 3) Oops. New exceptions now inherit from InstanceBusy
(Patch Set 4) Tests now tear down created instances

Change-Id: I9614740bba26c04e64b0e27c24fbace12334f4d1

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-09-28 15:14:56.000000000', 'message': "Accept message as sole argument to NovaException

Fixes bug 860666

Python nose will sometimes recreate an exception to add captured log
information to the string representation of the exception. It assumes
that it can do this by reinstantiating the class of the originally
triggered exception with one argument, a new string description.
NovaException, and some child classes, didn't work well with this
scheme and would result in a further exception during formatting, which
would result in an unformatted string being displayed.

Change-Id: I7152cb7809fa1deb3986c127370f670fb2da342d
"}]
commit_message:
Accept message as sole argument to NovaException

Fixes bug 860666

Python nose will sometimes recreate an exception to add captured log
information to the string representation of the exception. It assumes
that it can do this by reinstantiating the class of the originally
triggered exception with one argument, a new string description.
NovaException, and some child classes, didn't work well with this
scheme and would result in a further exception during formatting, which
would result in an unformatted string being displayed.

Change-Id: I7152cb7809fa1deb3986c127370f670fb2da342d

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-09-28 14:03:39.000000000', 'message': 'Fix 047 migration with SQLAlchemy 0.7.2

In 0.6.3, foreign_keys was an OrderedSet which can be indexed. In 0.7.2
it's a plain old set which can't be indexed.

  File ".../nova/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/047_remove_instances_fk_from_vif.py", line 35, in upgrade
      fkey_name = vifs.c.instance_id.foreign_keys[0].constraint.name
  TypeError: 'set' object does not support indexing

Change-Id: I8d6378d2fd25f7659d6a6469de762728639cc4ad
'}]
commit_message:
Fix 047 migration with SQLAlchemy 0.7.2

In 0.6.3, foreign_keys was an OrderedSet which can be indexed. In 0.7.2
it's a plain old set which can't be indexed.

  File ".../nova/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/047_remove_instances_fk_from_vif.py", line 35, in upgrade
      fkey_name = vifs.c.instance_id.foreign_keys[0].constraint.name
  TypeError: 'set' object does not support indexing

Change-Id: I8d6378d2fd25f7659d6a6469de762728639cc4ad

subject: Signer no longer fails if hashlib.sha256 is not available. test_signer unit test added.
messages:
[{'account_id': 7, 'date': '2011-09-27 15:10:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Brendan!

Is there a Launchpad bug report to go along with this patch? If so, please do git commit -a --amend and put something like "Fixes Bug#XXXXXX" in the commit message. That way, the bug status will be automatically updated in Launchpad.

Thanks!
-jay'}, {'account_id': 1610, 'date': '2011-09-27 15:40:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Jay,

There is no bug report to go with this patch.

Cheers,
Brendan'}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-09-27 17:21:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

Overall a fine change (thanks for the tests!). I have a couple comments (inline) and one question:

From what I understand nova.auth will be going away with the advent of Keystone, have you used/contributed to Keystone at all? I'd hate for us to lose tests or functionality when changing auth systems."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2011-09-27 20:02:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not sure I understand the ramifications of this.  If a client passes in a signature that used HMAC256, won't we fail to match the signature if we use SHA1?  I would think that we should be checking which SignatureMethod the client used and matching it, throwing an error if we cannot.  Did I misunderstand something?"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2011-09-28 07:07:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(1 inline comment)

Vish makes a good point - it looks like a client using sha1 won't be able to authenticate if sha256 is available to the server. It'd be good to verify that and file a bug for it

The current code makes sense in the context of boto as a client library; looks like we copied the code from there

However, I still think this is a good change in its own right - if sha256 isn't available, the code is just broken. The patch fixes that and unit tests the current behaviour ... it's just that the current behaviour has a bug :)"}, {'account_id': 1610, 'date': '2011-09-28 08:38:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1610, 'date': '2011-09-28 08:43:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Cheers for the review comments. I've implemented all and uploaded patch 2.

I will create a bug on launchpad for the situation where a client wants to use sha1 but the server supports sha256.

I wasn't aware nova.auth was been removed but I guess the tests are there now anyway :)"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2011-09-28 10:01:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

lgtm'}, {'account_id': 1610, 'date': '2011-09-28 10:02:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (3 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2011-09-28 10:05:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Thanks.  Looks good.  Thanks for adding a bug about sha1'}, {'account_id': 706, 'date': '2011-09-28 15:06:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, approved

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-09-28 15:07:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build Started https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova-merge/42/ (1/3)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-09-28 15:07:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Returning functionality of s3 backend to stream remote images

Fixes bug 860872. Also refactoring swift remote image tests to pull location data from registry now that it is unavailable from the main
api.

(Update) Fixed minor feedback for Waldon from Vek.

Change-Id: I159958da8ed4187da2e22392fe341042eedfd056

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-09-24 23:51:51.000000000', 'message': "Makes the servers create API call work with all schedulers, removes
'zone boot', and folds create_instance_helper back into servers
controller.

Fixes bug 844160

Notable changes:
1) compute API's create_at_all_once has been removed. It was only used
by zone boot.
2) compute API's create() no longer creates Instance DB entries. The
schedulers now do this. This makes sense, as only the schedulers will
know where the instances will be placed. They could be placed locally or
in a child zone. However, this comes at a cost. compute_api.create() now
does a 'call' to the scheduler instead of a 'cast' in most cases (* see
below). This is so it can receive the instance ID(s) that were created
back from the scheduler. Ultimately, we probably need to figure out a
way to generate UUIDs before scheduling and return only the information
we know about an instance before it is actually scheduled and created.
We could then revert this back to a cast. (Or maybe we always return a
reservation ID instead of an instance.)
3) scheduler* calls do not return a host now.  They return a value
that'll be returned if the caller does an rpc.call().  The casts to
hosts are now done by the scheduler drivers themselves.
4) There's been an undocumented feature in the OS API to allow multiple
instances to be built. I've kept it.
5) If compute_api.create() is creating multiple instances, only a single
call is made to the scheduler, vs the old way of sending many casts. All
schedulers now check how many instances have been requested.
6) I've added an undocumented option 'return_reservation_id' when
building. If set to True, only a reservation ID is returned to the API
caller, not the instance. This essentially gives you the old 'nova
zone-boot' functionality.
7) It was requested I create a stub for a zones extension, so you'll see
the empty extension in here. We'll move some code to it later.
8) Fixes an unrelated bug that merged into trunk recently where zones DB
calls were not being done with admin context always, anymore.

* Case #6 above doesn't wait for the scheduler response with instance
IDs. It does a 'cast' instead.

Change-Id: Ic040780a2e86d7330e225f14056dadbaa9fb3c7e

3) scheduler* calls do not return a host now.  They return a value

4) There's been an undocumented feature in the OS API to allow multiple

5) If compute_api.create() is creating multiple instances, only a single

commit_message:
compute_api create*() and schedulers refactoring

Fixes bug 844160

Makes the servers create API call work with all schedulers, removes
'zone boot', and folds create_instance_helper back into servers
controller.

Notable changes:
1) compute API's create_at_all_once has been removed. It was only used
by zone boot.
2) compute API's create() no longer creates Instance DB entries. The
schedulers now do this. This makes sense, as only the schedulers will
know where the instances will be placed. They could be placed locally or
in a child zone. However, this comes at a cost. compute_api.create() now
does a 'call' to the scheduler instead of a 'cast' in most cases (* see
below). This is so it can receive the instance ID(s) that were created
back from the scheduler. Ultimately, we probably need to figure out a
way to generate UUIDs before scheduling and return only the information
we know about an instance before it is actually scheduled and created.
We could then revert this back to a cast. (Or maybe we always return a
reservation ID instead of an instance.)
3) scheduler* calls do not return a host now.  They return a value
that'll be returned if the caller does an rpc.call().  The casts to
hosts are now done by the scheduler drivers themselves.
4) There's been an undocumented feature in the OS API to allow multiple
instances to be built. I've kept it.
5) If compute_api.create() is creating multiple instances, only a single
call is made to the scheduler, vs the old way of sending many casts. All
schedulers now check how many instances have been requested.
6) I've added an undocumented option 'return_reservation_id' when
building. If set to True, only a reservation ID is returned to the API
caller, not the instance. This essentially gives you the old 'nova
zone-boot' functionality.
7) It was requested I create a stub for a zones extension, so you'll see
the empty extension in here. We'll move some code to it later.
8) Fixes an unrelated bug that merged into trunk recently where zones DB
calls were not being done with admin context always, anymore.
9) Scheduler calls were always done with admin context when they should
elevate only when needed.
10) Moved stub_network flag so individual tests can run again.

* Case #6 above doesn't wait for the scheduler response with instance
IDs. It does a 'cast' instead.

Change-Id: Ic040780a2e86d7330e225f14056dadbaa9fb3c7e

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-09-26 23:47:10.000000000', 'message': 'Setting error state when spawn fails

fixes bug 851374 & bug 858679

This also removes instance_set_state from
db/api.py as that was causing these exceptions in
the first place. manager.py has a method for
updating the instances.

Change-Id: I199aa6900890531b175e28c3b93d8dfb88e135d0
'}, {'created': '2011-09-27 14:35:24.000000000', 'message': "Raise InsufficientFreeMemory

Kind of fixes bug 851374 & bug 858679

Raises InsufficientFreeMemory if an instance can't
start because of that. This will cause the normal

commit_message:
Raise InsufficientFreeMemory

Kind of fixes bug 851374 & bug 858679

Raises InsufficientFreeMemory if an instance can't
start because of that. This will cause the normal
instance failure recovery to catch this problem,
set the state, and log the error. This also
removes instance_set_state from db/api.py as that
was causing these exceptions in the first place.

Change-Id: I199aa6900890531b175e28c3b93d8dfb88e135d0

Changes swift-ring-builder exit codes

non-zero for operations that have errored or need attention.

Fixes bug 836922

commit_message:
Fix some minor issues due to premature merge of original code.

Consolidate duplicated code between delete() and force_delete(). Treat soft
deleted instances like hard deleted instances in queries. Fix running unit
tests individually do to using flags from a non-imported module.

blueprint deferred-delete-instance

Change-Id: Id58b607320536364867ee5c8d347b250406d9a2d

commit_message:
put fully qualified domain name in local-hostname

make metadata service return fully qualified domain name (fqdn) in
the local-hostname field. (bug 854614)

Also, move the dhcp_domain flag from being in nova.network.linux_net to be
in the more common nova.network.manager.  Since it is being used for
something more generic, it shouldnt be stuck in linux_net.

Change-Id: Ieab3cb1b7b0b78aff8df25bbc35b96924a8e7e60

revisions:
[{'created': '2011-09-23 21:30:31.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes LP Bug #850685

Handle 300 Multiple Choices gracefully in client

This patch adds a new exception MultipleChoices that
is now raised when the client encounters a 300 from the
server, with a helpful error message indicating the likely
cause is that the caller has forgotten to include a version
string in the request URI.

Change-Id: I3ccc2686bea30a770751fde605c78a3b7c5930b6
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes LP Bug #850685

Handle 300 Multiple Choices gracefully in client

This patch adds a new exception MultipleChoices that
is now raised when the client encounters a 300 from the
server, with a helpful error message indicating the likely
cause is that the caller has forgotten to include a version
string in the request URI.

Change-Id: I3ccc2686bea30a770751fde605c78a3b7c5930b6

Add next links to images requests

This adds next links to list images responses in JSON and xml.
It keeps all other filters and query parameters in tact to ensure
pagination works correctly when using the next links.

Makes sure to recreate gateway for moved ip

If nova moves an ip when setting up dhcp, make sure to reset
the default gateway.  Fixes bug 859587

subject: * Rework osapi to use network API not FK backref * Fixes lp854585
messages:
[{'account_id': 385, 'date': '2011-09-23 16:02:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2011-09-23 16:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

removed a duplicate line in .gitignore'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2011-09-23 16:53:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

What do the name label changes in xenapi (set_vdi_name_label, etc) have to do with this fix?

Also it might be cleaner to do the .gitignore and tools/rfc.sh in a separate merge proposal.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-09-23 17:01:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I don't doubt that this fixes the branch, but I have to major concerns:

1) Some of the view logic was moved out of the view builders and into controllers. I question this because it makes the view builders much less useful

2) To build a server entity, we now have to rpc call to get the network information from the network manager. This could cause some latency in the api that we should try to avoid. Could you implement the function at the network api level?"}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2011-09-23 17:23:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2011-09-23 17:24:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2011-09-23 17:27:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@Dan, not sure how the xen stuff slipped in there. I removed it and the .gitignore stuff. I'll just put it in my repo ignore until nova figures out the whole git thing."}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2011-09-23 17:37:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: (2 inline comments)

@Brian I put some comments inline to ask for clarification. Not sure I follow exactly. I was trying to match the Processing|Presentation pattern, if you could expand on your comments a little more so I could fix it up, I'd appreciate it."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2011-09-23 17:49:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Jason.

Would you mind pulling out the pip-requires changes (for bzr and GitPython)?

Also you modified test_misc as well. I think that should go into another commit as well.

---

Other than that what you've done here seems reasonable and fixes the issue with IP's not displaying in the OSAPI."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-09-23 17:54:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(2 inline comments)

Clarified my concerns. The things Dan just pointed out are related to a branch that just went in to trunk. Not sure what's up there."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2011-09-23 18:00:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Brian,

Regarding your concerns about the RPC call:

I think that is just how this is going to work now. To go back and use the database would mean reverting all of this (back to bzr 1594 where we removed the vif <--> instances relationship).

I mean we already do something similar with Glance when we get requests for images. If networks are also going to be treated as a separate service that seems to me to be a reasonable way for this to work.'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2011-09-23 19:18:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (2 inline comments)

Yea the files are from rebasing off of trunk and gerrit being behind trunk when its pushed. Other comments inline.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2011-09-23 19:22:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Thanks. I'm good with this fix for now."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-09-23 20:24:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

Can you find me on IRC to talk about the presentation logic comment?'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2011-09-23 21:17:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, approved

Thanks for working with me to explain things, Jason.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-09-23 21:17:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Build Started https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova-merge/19/ (1/3)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-09-23 21:17:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Build Started https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova-pep8/1391/ (2/3)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2011-09-23 21:17:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Don't use GitPython for authors check

I hit this issue with an older GitPython version:

  https://bugzilla.redhat.com/740852

Seeing as all GitPython is doing for us is running:

  $> git rev-list --pretty=raw HEAD

and parsing the output, I figure it's just as easy for us to run git
directly.

Change-Id: Ib43e2346c7d4c47e7776919f2b9c982133628129

commit_message:
Pull volume-cleanup-2 from bzr

Killed AOEVolumeDriver.

Adding myself to the authors.

removed extraneous line from docs

Renamed discover_volume to prepare_attach, undiscover_volume to prepare_detach.

Killed 'num_shelves' flag; No use for it now that AOE is removed.

killed blades_per_shelf flag; no longer needed since AOE has been removed.

Killing more dead code from removing AOE

more removal of aoe stuff

rip out more aoe

one more

Removing export_devices table.

splitting up volume and compute coupling

fixing some pep8 errors.

fix log string and detach_volume

change attach_volume to pass in connection_info

Adding new field to the block_device_mapping model.

Adding a migration file to add a device_path field to block_device_mapping.

more decoupling

WIP changes being handed off to vish.

finish rewriting initialize and terminate

split out code into driver classes

continue to cleanup volume attach code

move login code to libvirt volume driver

add an exception for libvirt volume driver

renumber migration scripts

add libvirt volume drivers

fix method signature typos

happy path finished

fix xen tests/code

fix/speedup cloud test cases

fixing block device info in terminate

disconnect from boot volumes on terminate

fix typo

no need to terminate volumes from hostless instance.  If it has no host, they never got created

cascade deletes for block device mapping instead of iterating through and deleting

keep error traceback. Fixed double use of mount_device

missed one reference to connection

write some volume driver tests and fix typos

live migration/boot-from-volume test completed

change migrate numbers

fix remote error to come from nova exception and test_compute

fix the fake volume driver

fix bdm delete and add back discover

use stubs instead of setattr

fix virt driver test

pull in changes from manager

changes from volume api

fix scheduler test

fix integrated attach volume test

compare as string instead of converting to int

fix rescan and messed up permissions

renumber migrations

use tuples for login and logout

make it work when we are on the same host

Change-Id: I8f72c65b4cbd781140aebc8266886da8cfaccc83
